Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel, friendly staff and reasonable prices!”
Reviews.Author: Sandracmcgrath
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the start and at the end of our turkey / Bulgaria trip. We like this hotel a lot. The staff couldn't do more for you. For our last night we arrived into istanbul on the Sofia night train / bus at 6 am - and rocked up to the hotel mainly just to have a sit down and leave our bags somewhere (knowing we wouldn't be able to check in properly until later), the staff took our bags no problem, made us feel right at home and let us have breakfast there and then which was so nice of then. Rooms are lovely ad clean and the beds are really comfortable. For breakfast there is a great selection buffet style. Hotel is very centrally located walking distance to all the major sights. Watch out for the shoe shine scams when going round Istanbul! where the guy 'accidentally' drops his brush, you go to tell him, he shakes your hand and offers you a 'free' shoe shine - give that brush a good kick into the street if one lands near you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful reception staff”
Reviews.Author: PatriciayRaul
Reviews.Content: We wanted to thank the reception staff for their friendly help last Saturday afternoon when we run into the hotel asking them to call a taxi for us since it was raining cats and dogs and we were trying to get one since more than an hour and other hotels refused to help us. We were visiting the old city with our four old month baby and some friends who came over to spend the weekend and could not find anyone who wanted to help us to find a taxi. They were so kind that they even offered us a complimentary tea. We have already recommended the hotel to our friends who are looking for accommodation in May and really hope that their experience is as good as ours.

Reviews.Title: “It's good but does have a few issues.”
Reviews.Author: Siena
Reviews.Content: This was a really hard review to write because on the surface the hotel is good but it does have a few problems. It's in a good (albeit very busy) central area in Sultanhamet. It's close to a tram stop and lots of sights and restaurants. The rooms are a good size but some can be noisy. Ours was a noisy room but they did change it happily when asked. As you walk into the hotel you would swear it has had the same decor for the last 20 years but I was told it was refurbished in 2009. It looks a bit kitsch in the lobby with the velour oversized sofas and the cigarette smoke colored walls. Bedrooms are fresher looking and quite comfortable with hair dryers, tv's and kettle. Breakfast looks impressive as you walk in but on closer inspection some of the food looked a little wilted and there were 5 different types of olives which reduced the actual choices. The key cards to the rooms needed to be taken back to reception twice to be re-programmed which was annoying and I saw some other guests who had the same problem. The reception staff were nice but really need a bit more training and the hotel needs to up its professionalism a tad. I had pre-arranged a late checkout but reception knew nothing of this and I had to show them my copy of the email with the price I had been quoted. The inbound airport transfer was very efficient but the outbound one nearly ended in disaster when the driver was nearly 30 minutes late and we nearly missed the flight. So you see my problem - it was ok for the price paid and if you don't have high expectations then you will probably think it's fine. Woud we stay there again - no- we would pay extra and stay at the Amira or similar. Oh and if you are Turkish you pay half the price that we foreigners do!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: alastaira1
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, good service, well located close to lots of restaurants & close to public transport (trains, ferries & tram). Clean & comfortable room. In all, great value

Reviews.Title: “You cannot want anything more than this...”
Reviews.Author: AlenaBahrain
Reviews.Content: Everybody sang all praise for this hotel on Tripadvisor and that is why we chose it. I can only confirm what was said bellow. The rooms are not big, true, but the hotel staff makes it up completely... It seems like all the people in the hotel just likes what they do. They help, they make you feel welcome, they do it all so naturally... They help with all we asked, directions, baby cot, immediate airport transport of our lost mobile, postcard (selling and posting for us), booking trips, no problems with timing, no problems with payments... Everything very clear and straight... Just go there.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel close to the main sights”
Reviews.Author: Wine_Hound_1972
Reviews.Content: This would have to be by far one of my favourite hotel experiences ever. If you take away the clean and well equipped rooms, buffet breakfast (Turksh Style), free wifi, fantastic location including a nice quiet street what are you left with? Some of the warmest and friendliest service I have received in all of my travels. Genuine friendly people who do everything they can to make your stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. The staff love their hotel and city and express this to the guests at every opportunity. Not only did they help us see everything we wanted to but secured us a hard to get booking at a restaurant which was also excellent and were able to book us an airport transfer. Remember this is a 3 star hotel not a Kemplinkski palace but it punches well above it's 3 star weight.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous visit, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: arteclectic
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience, friendly staff, quiet street,very easy walk to Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. My room was very nice, clean, wonderful bathroom with lots of hot water. Breakfast was good and a delightful ceramics store right across the street! Agreat place to stay for a day or a week!

Reviews.Title: “excellent quality in everything!”
Reviews.Author: Stamatia T
Reviews.Content: This hotel feels like home to me. The staff very friendly. The breakfast full of different tastes, and the rooms nicely decorated and cute. The area right in the centre of everything yet a quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen059
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 days at this hotel. It was a wonderful vacation and the hotel made it so. All of the staff was fabulous. They made any reservations we wanted and helped us with all of our itinerary and directions. The breakfast buffet was the best! So much to choose from, we never got tired of our breakfast. Our room was nice size with a mini bar. They sent a car to pick us up at the airport, free and then on the return we had the same car service, however we did pay for that ourselves. It was fine and not expensive. The location was great! Right in Sultanhmet and we could walk everywhere and felt perfectly safe. We absolutely loved Istanbul and the Maywood Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: ClaireSheffield_UK
Reviews.Content: This hotel was brilliant. The room was lovely and the location of the hotel istelf was perfect as we were able to walk everywhere or get the tram which is 2 minutes away. Breakfast was great with a huge selection so there is something for everyone. For anyone stying at the hotel, don't go to the restaurant opposite the Maywood as we went there once and the food really wasn't that great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mickey77London
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Maywood for 5 nights during our trip to Istanbul. We found the hotel to be nice, clean and cheap enough. Good location and friendly staff. Nice breakfast with fresh fruits, cold meats, cheeses, pastries and cakes, toast and tea or coffee. Our room was well-furnished and the bathroom was okey. I can really recommend Maywood Hotel to everyone who goes to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Aidil_o
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful and the hotel was nice, well-kept, comfortable and clean. Definitely conveniently located - within walking distance of most of the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: lluv2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maywood on a family trip of 4 adults so we had 2 rooms. Both rooms were very comfortable and had a little balcony. What really made this hotel special was its location (5 minutes walk from most of the major sites) and the staff - right from the front desk to the staff cleaning the rooms. They were extremely helpful with advice on how to get to places, the best hamam location, the best Turkish Delight...they helped us organise some of our tours and the front desk was manned 24*7. At the time of departure each couple was presented with a present of Turkish Delight and Apple tea. A very nice gesture. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Anne172
Reviews.Content: The Maywood Hotel is in a great location near the historic sites. It is in a quiet street so there is no traffic or tram noise but it is only a couple of minutes walk to the nearest tram stop. It is nicely decorated and most importantly for a good nights sleep the bed was very comfortable. Everything was very clean. Tea (10 different flavours!) and coffee facilities were available in the room. I stayed for five nights and I was very well looked after by the front desk staff who were very friendly and efficient and every request for assistance was handled immediately. There is a free computer in the lobby for guests to use. If you want you can use the indoor swimming pool and sauna at no extra cost at their sister hotel which is two minutes walk away. On leaving I was given two lovely gifts of a box of Turkish Delight and a packet of Apple Tea with little cups and saucers. A nice reminder of the Maywood Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very kind staff”
Reviews.Author: Angeliki_and_friends
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect! I strongly recommend it!! The staff was exceptional and very helpful and they gave us presents when we left! Thank you again for our pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Horowir
Reviews.Content: Once the taxi dropped us off, we were greeted pleasantly by a myriad of staff. Since we made arrangements with the hotel to provide taxi service we didn't even have to worry about paying after drop off. Once we reached our room we were pleasantly surprised by its size and cleanliness as well as decor. The hotel is located right down the street from the Hagia Sophia. On our first evening we walked to the New Mosque and Spice Market then had dinner right by the hotel. Each morning there was a tremendous buffet breakfast which was included in the very fair rate. To our surprise and delight the staff called us a cab for departure and provided us two lovely parting gifts. A wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: DkLorenzo
Reviews.Content: Was there for five days. Great design. Nice rooms. Very good breakfast. Good central location. One thing bad was The bathroom The water In The shower Would come out a bit but nothing Big. Would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near sites.”
Reviews.Author: Mntnaz
Reviews.Content: The driver had a bit of trouble finding the hotel, but not a real problem. We had a room on the second floor overlooking the hotel entrance. No problems with street noise. Both the room and bathroom were a decent size. Bathroom shower was quite small and the water pressure went down completely around 8 am. The breakfast was plentiful, with something for everyone. Free wireless Internet worked well. The staff was great...always helpful. They directed us to the local sites and also ensured we had a taxi driver to the cruise port that wouldn't rip us off. A really good value and within walking distance to the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IreneEM
Reviews.Content: Unbeatable location, friendly staff and great breakfast buffet

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravel_UK
Reviews.Content: Travelling with family for 8 days in October 2011, I was very anxious to find a hotel that was clean and comfy, particularly as I was travelling with 2 children (aged 1 and 4). Having researched Turkish hotels for 2 weeks, I was dismayed to find that the hotels within my price range (about Â£75/night) had quite discouraging reviews. Recommended by a friend, I selected Maywood as the price was just right and reviews were very good in relation to the hotel's price bracket. Having returned a week ago, I can confirm that the hotel is entirely worthy of the rave reviews. The staff were friendly and helpful right through our stay and particularly prompt when it came to resolving any problems. Happy to provide touristy guidance, but never tried to sell us any tour packages or give dodgy restaurant recommmendations, which I really appreciated. Breakfast was fresh and varied and the service very customer friendly; there was no rushing people out of the door near closing time or reluctance to replenish supplies. The couple of times that we requested an omlette or a different kind of tea bag, the Hotel manager himself serviced our requests and was friendly and helpful throughout our stay. My children were delighted to find that there was a little parrot at Reception, and were regular visitors to it (and the well-stocked sweet jar at the desk!). Location wise, it's fantastic. Just a couple of minutes away from the tram stop and train station and about 20 mins away from the major sights. The immediate neighbourhood comprises several souvenir shops and restaurants which make for a pleasant stroll at any time of day. The rooms were very comfy and cleaned well every day. Tea and coffee making supplies were replenished regularly also. Do bear in mind that the room sizes can vary greatly, so do take a look at the available rooms to see what suits. And if you do find the room unsatisfactory for any reason, do tell them as they are very cooperative in relocating. As for the downsides...An issue we did have was with the water supply, which would stop and start at random moments, which was an irritation. We also found that the centrally controlled A/C system did mean that when the weather turned and the heating was switched on, our room did tend to get uncomfortably hot and the only solution was to switch the system off and open a window, which didn't help much.However, the staff did address/resolve issues immediately so i think the issues just indicate that some maintenance/renovation work is in order at the Hotel. Do bear in mind that the Hotel gives a 10% discount for cash payment (applied automatically) which makes the stay even better value for money.We were given Turkish Tea sets and Turkish delight as farewell gifts, which was a very nice touch and just summarise the essence of this cosy hotel...brilliant customer service. Thanks to the Manager and all staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great stay.”
Reviews.Author: I B
Reviews.Content: 4 Star hotel! My wife and I stayed at the Maywood Hotel for 4 nights for a relaxing stay in Istanbul and cannot recommend the hotel enough. The room was comfortable, spacious and quite. The staff were very helpful and more than willing to assist with any queries we had.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: nellie638
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the Maywood and would have stayed longer if they had rooms available. The rooms were larger than other hotels in Istanbul (we stayed at one other hotel and had friends staying at another 2 hotels). The room was comfortable and tea and coffee making facilities and a fridge were provided in the room. The breakfast buffet had an amazing range of great food. The staff were friendly and helpful. Somebody else commented that they had problems with the airconditioning - we had no problems, the air conditioner worked well and we could also open the glass door onto a balcony for fresh air. My only complaint was that the mattress was a bit too hard.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, central and convenient”
Reviews.Author: kbergaust
Reviews.Content: Two grown up female friends and colleagues traveling together, our purpose was a working weekend catching up with the Istanbul Biennial after a seminar with a larger group in a hotel in the Taksim area. Maywood was a good experience, we stayed in similar rooms in the same corridor for two nights, Friday to Sunday. Friendly welcome, working wi-fi everywhere (we experienced erratic services in other Istanbul hotels), good breakfast and a central location was important to our choice. We appreciated the peaceful atmosphere and the sea-gull wake-up call from the sea-side nearby. The location is central both to transportation (the tram is essential to move around, taxis are stuck in traffic jams) and historical sights, as well as the Grand Bazar, the spice market and many of the historical sights of Istanbul. Hardwood floors, very good beds and clean and fresh decoration with a slightly kitchy Turkish baroque feel to it, added to the experience. The only downside was the temperature and air quality system. The air conditioning was not effective, and it was not an alternative to turn it off, as the windows only could be opened very little. Even so, I plan to return to Maywood for a stay with my family later!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: markenbc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maywood for 3 nights in Sept. prior to a cruise. The pick-up service included in our rate was very easy to find as we exited the immigration area. The staff at the hotel could not have been more welcoming or helpful and were always there with a hello or a willingness to help with sightseeing suggestions. The breakfast buffet is typically european with something there for even the pickiest appetite. Try the yoghurt and honey - it is amazing!!! Within walking distance of absolutely everything and the tram is almost right outside the door - if you are going farther afield. While we had twin beds (that were very comfortable) our room had a wonderful deep bathtub that was fabulous after a long day of sightseeing. I would without a doubt return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “May you stay at the Maywood - I would!”
Reviews.Author: MrFredBahrain
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Maywood for 5 nights and really enjoyed the experience. The staff were super-friendly and helpful (particularly when the hotel computer needed to be changed to an english keyboard!), and the hotel is extremely well situated in the old city with easy access to the top attractions (5 minute walk) and the Bosphorous sea-front. There are excellent restaurants nearby, and a great tram and railway link, and while the streets are narrow - and impossibly 'two way flow' - taxis do manage to get to the hotel without too much hassle, and nothing that a bit of backing up cannot fix! Our room (304) faced the street and only occasionally did we hear a shout. It had a tiny balcony, a small but adequate bathroom with an excellent shower, two single beds (they offered to move us to a double bed), but limited cupboard space, or a place to put suitcases (But hey, old is generally tiny!) Spotlessly clean - the only thing is that that don't provide a minimum of bottled water, even though they advise you not to drink the tap water. The breakfast - from 7.00 to 11.00 is humungous although the coffee was Nescafe!! Furniture in main areas is period style and fits in very well.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute diamond in the rough bargain.”
Reviews.Author: maddashin
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on Trip advisor originally. Decided to book it based on the reviews. I am not disappointed. We got off the cruise by 8 30 and arrived here by 9 30. We were not to check in till late afternoon. They said we could have breakfast at the hotel. They had a Turkish buffet here. The buffet was marvelous. Amazing. The dining room is beautiful. The rooms are old style because they are in "Old Town" but a great boutique hotel and inwould stay here again and again. The Turkish people are attractive, friendly and just plain nice. Very welcoming to Americans. Great sense of humor.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, walking distance to sights and reasonable cost!”
Reviews.Author: nt7169
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a weekend in September. The hotel is very clean, spacious rooms and bathroom. Our room faced a quiet street and was airconditioned. The breakfast was varied and plentiful, the staff was very helpful and well informed, arranging taxis for us and recommending places to go. The hotel is well positioned, a walking distance from main sights, which was great. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “very kindly cancelled on day of arrival and made no charge”
Reviews.Author: iffabug
Reviews.Content: I was very sick on day of travel and could not make trip to istanbul. I emailed the hotel on day i was due to arrive and they very kindly offered not to charge my credit card. Most hotels would charge 1 night or even the whole vacation time booked. This is very nice thought by Maywood Hotel and when in istanbul again i will definitely stay here!. Thanks to all at Hotel Maywood.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Nishman
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice and friendly. The hotel is located a little ((pleasant) walk away from Istanbul Spice Market and not far from the main attractions (Archaeological Museum, Blue Mosque, Aghia Sofia etc..) The room was very clean and quite beautiful, the wifi worked well. There was a TV and a minibar as well as an air conditioner. The bathroom was very clean and had a bathtub. We even got a little present of Lukkoum and Tea as we left. Buffet breakfasts are totally satisfactory. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel precautions”
Reviews.Content: The hotel is all the things that most people say about it. Which is good. But as it was our first stop in Istanbul, the bedbug bites that appeared after our second night at the Maywood, were either from our overnight Turkish Airlines flight or the Maywood. (Only I was badly bitten as we were in separate beds)The front desk staff very quickly sent cleaning staff to strip the beds and check and vacuum the matresses. They also gave me some lotion to reduce the itching. Recommend you do the check for bedbugs very carefully on your arrival at any hotel as bedbugs can be found at even the best of establishments. We did the bedbug check in every other place we stayed at for the entire month. A pain, but never as bad as the experience with these critters. It was over three weeks before the bite marks began to totally disappear. Fenistil from their local pharmacies reduces the itching.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great front desk and very clean. Good location”
Reviews.Author: RubyIsland
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Wish the beds were together, but minor feature. Staff very pleasant! Clean! Great location. Good value! They even gave is a small parting gift upon check out.... Apole tea and Turkish Delights! What a nice surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet and Cozy Hotel in Old City of Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: JiMinHan
Reviews.Content: I felt so comfortable while staying @ Maywood hotel! Especially the staffs here are really friendly and were always there for guests. Hope to go back and stay again in near future :)

Reviews.Title: “We were amazed and will return”
Reviews.Author: Edmund B
Reviews.Content: We couldnâ€™t have found a better located hotel for our sightseeing tours in Istanbul. You can reach all important tourist attractions from this hotel by foot in short distances. This relatively small boutique hotel is a jewel in the old quarters of town. The rooms are very comfortable and tastefully decorated. Yes, they are not big, but so are almost all hotel accommodations in the old part of Istanbul. The staff goes out of its way to help and please the guests. The hotel offers a breakfast buffet so plentiful and delicious that it will be difficult to find one in Istanbul that can top it. Saying that, we canâ€™t understand the complains about the breakfast in some of the reviews we read before making the reservation. If you need to eat English smoked fish or German Leberkaese donâ€™t go to Istanbul. Last but not least, the hotel has a wonderful bonus service. If you stay three days or longer they will pick you up at Attaturk Airport for free. If not, the Maywood has an arrangement with transportation enterprises that beats any shuttle service â€“ 20 Euros for two one way from and to Attaturk Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: picciona
Reviews.Content: Hotels in strategic position to visit the center of Istanbul. The rooms vary in size, we stayed in a spacious top floor. Quiet and comfortable. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean and with good and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: danid0ll
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 times at this hotel in our trip. 4 days when we got to Turkey (then we went to Capadocia, Bodrun, Pammukale, etc) and 2 more days at the end of the trip. We were in a group of 5 and booked 2 rooms. We really enjoyed the hotel. The hotel is very well located, near the Top Kap, Sophia, Blue Mosque, Bosphorus, tram. The hotel is in very good shape, everything is new ou renovated, and the rooms were always clean. The hotel provides transportation to pick you in the airport if you stay more than 3 nights. It worked very well. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, and suggested many restaurants and places for us to go when we asked (and were not anoying us trying to sell tour packages). The only problem we found was that when taking a bath sometimes the shower leaked, wetting the bathroom floor. But that was not really an issue for us. The air conditioner and the wireless worked very well, and they also have a computer with internet acess in the reception, that also works well. The breakfast is very full of choices. When we left the hotel they gave us a gift: an apple tea set and a turkish delight pack. Very nice! Highly reccomend this hotel, specially considering the price. OBS: We went to the restaurant in front of the hotel (was not a hotel reccomendation), Galata Restaurant, and we don't reccomend it at all. Very turist, pricy and the dishes were not good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JunkoTokyo
Reviews.Content: We have stayd Maywood hotel while we stayed In the Istanbul. We are family of 5, so we took Two rooms. The hotel is super clean and staff are very helpful. The location is very close to St. Sophia, underground Palace, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazzar, and many good restaurants around there. We will definitely come back to this hotel for our next Istanbul trip. Highly recomendable!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Tourist Area”
Reviews.Author: ellis6
Reviews.Content: We were family of 6 with 3 rooms. Good sized rooms and good location for walking out to tourist areas or catching the tram. Manager was very friendly and even helped us book our next leg of holiday online.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Bub2401
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in this hotel for my son's wedding in Istanbul. I loved it. The room was so nice and comfortable. The staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful. It is close to a tram station or the hotel will call a taxi whenever you want it. The hotel provides free airport shuttle from the airport to the hotel. They will arrange transportation from the hotel to the airport. I felt very much at home here.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel and enjoyed our stay there”
Reviews.Author: PeymanTehran
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an old city istanbul whoch makes it so easy to have access to many of the historical places. It is only two stations (10 minute walk) away from Sultan Ahmet square. The friendly behavior of the receptionist who were really trying their best to answer all the requests was the other excellent point about this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: natalielauren21
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered excellent service, lovely rooms and decorations, air conditioning, amazing continental breakfast and all for a great price and within walking distance (10 minutes or less) to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, the Grand Bazzar, Topkapi Palace, etc., etc. The porter brought our bags to our room and even brought us tea to our room and gave us free postcards :) A really wonderful way to experience Istanbul, I would highly recommend this hotel. Thank you for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “we loved this hotel and we will be back for sure.”
Reviews.Author: demmytheo
Reviews.Content: ..so close by foot to all historical attractions ,to bosporus tour, to tram, clean hotel,quite enough,staff very helpful,excellent service,nice buffet,,,nice decoration,,,,everything was perfect!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “we will definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: jasmina12
Reviews.Content: we really liked the hotel, it is very well located, has excellent service, delicious oriental breakfast, free pick up service from the airport,... will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price , Great location ....... a good choice”
Reviews.Author: beanodan
Reviews.Content: First of all the location is great ,so close to the tram ,the river and main attractions , but quiet enough location that you get a full nights sleep which was great . Although people rave about the breakfasts i thought it was just ok , lots of choice but not of top quality , but it is usually included as part of a great overall price . The staff were always friendly and helpful . TOP TIPS go to the Shaphire tower (the tallest office building in Europe for spectacular roof top views of Istanbul ....... amazing views and just not advertised enough ) To get there catch the Metro at Taxim sq to the station 4 levant (about 5 stops) and its there when you come out of the Metro ...... after you have visited the viewing gallery go up the next floor marked photographers gallery for the open air view

Reviews.Title: “All your needs covered”
Reviews.Author: jayman976
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maywood for 3 nights. The location is brilliant as you are near the water, great restaraunts and the sights! The staff are friendly and the rooms are great and the breakfast will blow your mind! So many interesting foods! We actually have decided to return again it was so good.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: ATBN
Reviews.Content: I am just back from a week at this hotel. The location is ideal for oldtown sites. The place is clean, well maintained, and of generally higher quality than other palces in its immediate surrounding. The breakfast buffet offered a good variety of items. The rooms are cleans and well maintained. We asked, insisted on, and finally received a back room on the quiet side so noise was not a problem. However, I must sepatately address the high and genuine quality of service at this hotel. The generally young staff were friendly, helpful, and honestly interested in helping you out with every little demand, and I am the type of traveller that has many of those. never a raised eyebrow, never a sign of frustration. Tesekor!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PenkiArnhem
Reviews.Content: Noise from the street can be loud but then again I am a lihght sleeper. I requested another room at the backside of the hotel which I got the second night withjout any problems. Website is a bit confusing. I thought they also had a restaurant for lunch and dinner but it is for breakfast only, but in the direct neightbourhoud there are a lot of nice places to eat. Good choice for a city trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to set up”
Reviews.Author: benbitter
Reviews.Content: Istanbul can be a little in your face, and the Maywood hotel is a nice sanctuary. It is quite, comfortable, and in a good location for the sites. The breakfast is quite large and the rooms are a good value. I would say that the area is not great for night-life as you have to go across the river for a lot of other stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service!”
Reviews.Author: sumank
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Maywood Hotel in June 2011. The staff is extremely friendly and spoke English very well. They even gave us 2 boxes of Turkish delight as a parting gift! The location is on a side street which was nice since it was relatively quiet for being in the middle of a large city. Within 5 minutes you can reach the tram stop, which was the most convenient way to reach Galata Bridge. It took us about 15-20 minutes to walk to Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and the Undeground Cistern. We had the triple room with 3 single beds. Most comforable bed during my 2 weeks in Turkey. Small bathroom but the shower was fantastic! They even had speakers in the bathroom so if the television was on, you could listen! The room layout is a little tight so not a lot of space for suitcases. I enjoyed the in-room tea pot and tea bags. There was a small table with chairs so we could enjoy a hot drink after walking around all day. The closet also had a safe which was helpful to keep your valuables in. The buffet breakfast was the best of all the places we stayed at in Turkey over our 2 weeks. Nice variety of pastries, fruit, meat, cheese and veggies. I highly recommend the Sultanahmet Fish House Restaurant near the Grand Baazar. The food was different, tasty and not overpriced. They even provided us with a free ride home since it started to rain during dinner. We also enjoyed Fados Restaurant. The portions were huge!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: NYC_angus
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our time staying at the Maywood Hotel. The rooms are clean and the staff is extremely helpful and nice. We loved the breakfast too! For us, the location was perfect- close to the Bosphorus and tram stop; short walks to the main mosques, Grand Bazaar, etc. They even gave us a little gift when we left. Only minor negative- the showers are small, but they worked great. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Shamrock_Wallace
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend this place. Good location close to the old town sites and Beyoglu, free airport transfer, clean, friendly staff, helpful, and gifts on departure. All around good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel close to the historical sites”
Reviews.Author: needtotravelmore_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights which really the bare minimum for Istanbul. The hotel has a great location just off the tramline and is with easy walking distance (10 mins) of the historical sites. The rooms were a reasonable size and spotlessly clean.. The breakfast was very good with enough choice to please everyone. They said they would treat us like family and they did, what more can I say. It was good value too.

Reviews.Title: “A real turkish treasure”
Reviews.Author: cimikiy
Reviews.Content: This is my secound time here in Istanbul and I have to say that i simply love this hotel. Is wonderfull, u enter in the hotel and u see the beuatifull lobby, and didnÂ´t stop there, the rooms are equaly beautifull and the salon where u have the breakfast is even more beautifull. The rooms are very nice and clean, the bed are very confortable and the bathroom is very spacious. Ohh and the breakfast?! I have to say, I never seen so many options like this before. The staff there is very thoughtfull and kind, if u need any help, IÂ´m sure they would help with a big smile in their faces. And the location is awesome, because the Blue Mosque is like 10 min by walk, and u have the train station very close. If u go to Istanbul u have to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Well Done Maywood”
Reviews.Author: royhy
Reviews.Content: Just finished our month-long vacation, and I feel compelled to drop a quick note praising the Maywood Hotel. Rooms are cute (we stayed in room 505), clean, and comfortable. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Wi-Fi access is an added bonus, and so is the legitimate free breakfast buffet. Location is ideal, and price is very reasonable. Well Done Maywood!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: kathykar
Reviews.Content: A lovely bit of boutique luxury here. Situated on a quiet lane but 2 minutes from shops, local eateries and transport though you can walk to any attraction in the old city. The hotel itself is all charm and elegance, with a lovely lobby and restaurant (breakfast only). The rooms were spacious with a disctinctly Turkish oriental feel and bathrooms clean and modern with lots of fresh towels and toiletries. Good price for the convenience of location and quality. Staff always smiling and helpful. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, nice rooms, good location for historical sites”
Reviews.Author: Fuzby
Reviews.Content: Our experience here was mostly quite positive. The pluses: easy to walk to many of the major historical attractions of old Istanbul, also close to a tram stop. The front desk staff try hard to be helpful. Our room was very nice. Breakfast was not the best food we have had touring the region, but it was fine. Pickup from the airport was free and prompt. A few glitches - our room was not ready at the usual check-in time, and the staff seemed rather overwhelmed. When they first gave us a key, we opened the door to a room with twin beds - not what we had booked for a couples vacation. After waiting another 20 minutes, they gave us a very nice double room. The computer in the lobby, from which we were trying to print boarding passes, did not work well at all, and we finally gave up. But these were minor snafus, and overall we had a pleasant stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the best location”
Reviews.Author: mick3187
Reviews.Content: Very well located, the Maywood provides good, clean rooms and friendly service. The hotel appears recently renovated, so that standards are high.

Reviews.Title: “Cute place, quiet street”
Reviews.Author: taintedthought
Reviews.Content: The hotel was on a nice quiet street surrounded by restaurants. Though it wasn't right next to the main tourist attractions (like Hagia Sophia), it's only 10 minute walk away. I liked that it was in between that region and Eminonu/Spice Market. There were a few incidents involving towels that occurred, but they were quickly rectified by the incredibly courteous staff (one day the dirty towels were taken away but no new towels were given, and we only got a towel to put outside the tub twice out of six days.) The rooms weren't large but they definitely sufficed and were clean and tastefully decorated. Breakfast had a nice spread, though I do wonder if any of the food was old since the serving bowls are very large portions (think a giant bowl of olives that probably would not be consumed within a week) and there was never a huge crush at breakfast. But there was a selection of cheese, breads, cold meats, and various other turkish dishes along with said olive bar. The walls are fairly thing, but I had quiet neighbors so this wasn't an issue except for a short period of time when someone turned on a tv. Then it was very loud. Just hope for quiet neighbors. The internet on the whole was bearable though a few times it was un-usably slow. One thing I wished i did was call the place directly to see if i could get a cash discount instead of booking through booking.com. I'm not sure if that is an option but it's probably worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “Congratulations to Maywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cred68
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights staying at the Maywood Hotel in Sirkeci, Istanbul. Excellent hotel. Attentive staff, great location, nice rooms, clean, modern and well equipped. Very good breakfast. I recommend it. Congratulations to hotel manager and his(her)team.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: OldFart06
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here. Great location - one block to train station and tram; only a short walk to Spice Bazaar and the port. Friendly staff who were very helpful. One of the nicest breakfast buffets that we had during our stay in Turkey. If you are tired of the restaurant hassle that is part of Istanbul, the one directly across the road is quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: pongotravels
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from Istanbul and loved the city and the Maywood Hotel. All the staff were extremely helpful , the room was beautifully decorated, exceptionally clean and the breakfast had huge choice and variety (especially the special omelettes made for us!). There were road works outside (which had nearly been finished during our stay) but we were out all day and they were not working at night, so it did not bother us at all. The hotel is close to all the main sights and near the tram stop. All in all we could not find a single fault with this hotel and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising and Relieving”
Reviews.Author: Chattaboogy
Reviews.Content: For a city as potentially overwhelming as Istanbul, this hotel was a welcome relief. The customer service was great, and the room was very nice as well. For the price paid, I thought this was a great deal. Though the location was not great, there is transportation within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “One of best hotels where we stay in 130 countries all over the world”
Reviews.Author: FERNANDORODRIGUES
Reviews.Content: They have everything. Simpathy ,eficienthy and care The room has everything we need Satelit TV more than 1000 chanels Internet wifi every time working Water pressure in bath very good Good liting Cofee and tea all available. We arrived very early in the morning,and imediatly invit us to breakfast We return for shure FERNANDO Estoril,Portugal

Reviews.Title: “Did NOT stay here, but I liked it!”
Reviews.Author: cambridgechica
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the last part of our trip, and it started off rocky. The free airport transfer was 40 minutes late from picking us up (supposedly due to traffic, but I checked the traffic map at the airport and it didn't look too bad). I overlooked this and also overlooked the fact that the airport transfer from Erboy Hotel, where we stayed the previous weekend, was prompt, was in much better condition, and was private. But then we got to the Sirkeci neighborhood. Notice I didn't say "hotel". We got off about 3 blocks from Maywood because it turned out that there was huge construction going on on the street where the hotel is. Our driver led us through muddy roads with pipes, rocks, and loud banging noise everywhere. Why didn't they let us know about this construction ahead of time??? They said it had just started 3 days before, which still would've been plenty of time to give us a heads up. I was starting to get really irritated. And then when we checked into our room, which was facing the noisy street, it had 2 twin beds, not 1 queen or king bed that we requested. The hotel was fully booked, but they said they could put a king mattress in our room if we want. Why hadn't they done this BEFORE we checked in??? This was the last straw. But what quickly turned around this miserable situation was the staff's pleasant, professional, and calm demeanor. They completely understood our dissatisfaction and checked if their sister hotel, Hotel Sapphire, had anything available, but it was also fully booked. They then served us with beverages and helped us look for another hotel. While we were using the public computer in the lobby, they were also checking online and making phone calls to check other hotels for us. And when we finally booked another hotel, they had a taxi waiting for us (which we didn't have to pay for) to take us to the other hotel. They apologized about the situation, and one of the last things they said to us was "Your vacation is more important to us, and we hope you enjoy the rest of your stay in Istanbul." If it hadn't been for the major construction and the beds, we would've stayed in Maywood Hotel, and I think we would've really liked it. Again, the staff is very professional, friendly, and helpful. The room where we were supposed to stay was clean and looked great. The location is pretty good--you can walk to restaurants, the Metro, and even the sites in Sultanahmet. It's really too bad that it just wasn't a good time to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: rikishefivered
Reviews.Content: we just came back from Istanbul where we stayed 4 nights @ Maywood. PROs: location, hospitality, room,breakfast, price. CONs: waiting for a pick up from airport can take 45 minutes. road constructions on the street, no sidewalks and dangerous walking around especially at night. BUT: this will end soon, so check with the hotel. ask for a backyard room for a quiet night.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money at the Maywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Quad_ESL57_fan
Reviews.Content: The Maywood Hotel is situated near Sirkeci station in the centre of Istanbul (European side) Staff were very helpful and friendly. Free internet in the lobby. The buffet breakfast had a choice of Turkish specialities, different choices of bread, sweets, fruit and yoghurt, Turkish tea and fruit juices. The room was quiet, although the bed was a bit short according to European standards. Bathroom was clean and ok.

Reviews.Title: “A safe bet in a city where you'll likely get duped at least once”
Reviews.Author: Casuku
Reviews.Content: I arrived from flight very late and most restaurants in the immediate area were closed but I was hungry. I asked the front desk where I can get food and the man said the kitchen was closed but that he could send fruit up to my room. A short while later someone knocked on my door with a large plate of delicious cut fruit (for free). This was a lovely start to my stay. All hotels I came across in Turkey incl breakfast as part of the hotel stay, no matter how cheap the room. The breakfast at Maywood was good - lots of options in a nice setting. It's not easy to find good coffee in Turkey but if you're lucky enough to be able to refine your skills at achieving just the right formula of nescafe, coffee mate, milk, bad drip coffee and sugar, you'd think you were in a small cafe on Commercial Drive in Vancouver or on College Street in Toronto drinking day-old coffee - not everyone will be able to master this as it takes practice, practice and desire to drink something that resembles coffee. Overall the rooms, service and location were very good and I would stay there again. It was one of the few places in Turkey where I didn't feel like people were trying to sell me something in addition to what was agreed to and the staff were in fact very helpful with any questions I had. The airport transfer was prompt and well organized. Note that that part of Istanbul can be noisy but that's not specific this to this hotel but to the Sultanamet/Sirkci area so just be aware of that. The Maywood faces a somewhat quieter alley so may be less noisy than other hotels in the immediate area. And remember to outright ignore the people that will try to get your attention every time you walk in and out of the hotel from the nearby shops. Trust me,... don't even look or say 'no, thank you' or anything to them unless you want to lose money or time. The location of the Maywood probably has less of this immediately outside it's doors than other hotels in a the area but it still happened at least once each time I walked in or out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice for the money”
Reviews.Author: George_FIL
Reviews.Content: The stuff was very kind and helpful, the room was clean, the choice of free tea in the room was good, the breakfast was delicious and the location is really perfect

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MAROAthens
Reviews.Content: We (3 girl friends) stayed in Maywood hotel 5 nights (from March 23rd to March 28th) and we were very happy with our choice. My friends had a twin room and I had a single one on the second floor. The rooms are of adequate size and nicely furnished. The hotel is spotless and very well located in the cityâ€™s old part. The service is excellent and they make you feel welcome at any time. The front desk employees were very polite, answered all our questions efficiently and helped us a lot. The breakfast buffet is extended, but we did not like most of the items offered. It was an oriental buffet with many salads, olives and other similar items and we would have liked a more continental kind of food. Istanbul is a great city, I plan to visit it again with my husband in the near future and we will certainly stay again in Maywood, which I recommend without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good, But There Are More Value for Money Options Out There”
Reviews.Author: Ti_Chan
Reviews.Content: We were swayed to stay at Maywood on our 4th leg of the trip because of the free airport pick up for min 2 nights. If not because of that, we wouldâ€™ve chosen to stay at Erboy (from our 1st leg). Maywood is okay â€“ but there are better choices out there. Room 504, booked via the hotel website (otherwise you don't get the bonuses) Pro: - Room size is acceptable. Loved the wooden flooring. Nice French dÃ©cor. Very comfy bed (best vs the other 3 hotels we stayed in Turkey). - Free wifi â€“ speed is OK - Rich breakfast selection - On time pick up service although itâ€™s only a cigarette smelled shuttle and not a private pick up. They waited for us although our flight got delayed for 45 mins. - 10% cash payment discount Cons: - The place starting to run down and surprisingly not fixed (?) (i.e. pipes broken â€“ although water still works, shower door broken, TV not working, light in the cupboard not working) - The shower cubicle is mini size! Donâ€™t get me wrong, the bathroom itself is good size â€“ but itâ€™s the shower cubicle that is miniscule! Iâ€™m Asian and even I got bumped all the time ha haâ€¦ - Service is not excellent (i.e. not mentioning the free wifi â€“ they only told us after I asked; did not offer umbrella when it rained and one of the waiter said a rather insulting comment about my husbandâ€¦) AND they are not responsive to emails (I tried twice). They only reply when you're booking but not to other questions.

Reviews.Title: “Also for future-visits : my favorite place to stay in Istanbul .”
Reviews.Author: sipenholz
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th visit to Istanbul and this time i really did find my ' home ' away form home here . Maywood has a fantastic location in Sultanahmet , near Sirkeci Trainstion , in a side street with more hotels and restaurants . If you are sensible for street noise , better ask for a room at the back . We really did feel very welcome here and the rooms are well equipped and very clean , so is the bathroom . Large breakfast buffet , good room-cleaning and good elevator . Receptionists speak enough English for good Info . Not an own Restaurant but enough choise of cheap and expensive .places very nearby .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laurent091
Reviews.Content: Very good Hotel , well placed and confortable. Staff very friendly and even the Hotel canary was welcoming! Only problem we had was that we could hear the next door rooms now and again but no big issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - excellent location, friendly service, comfortable accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelEvanston
Reviews.Content: What a great boutique hotel right in the heart of the old city! Walking distance to major attractions, easy access to public transportation, plenty of restaurants around. This is a new boutique hotel with charming, comfortable and clean rooms. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpfull. I would without hesitation recommend this hotel to anybody, who is looking for a great value, both in monetary sense and in terms of intangibles like warm and friendly atmosphere, and willingness of the hotel's staff to take an extra step to accomodate their guests' needs.

Reviews.Title: “ottimo albergo! consigliatissimo”
Reviews.Author: Elena_1981
Reviews.Content: I strongly suggest this hotel!!! 1. perfect location: between old historical area (sulthanamet) and night life / shopping area (beyoglu).. all is at walking distance from the hotel. Anyway tram (sirkeci tram station) is less than 1 minute walk 2. hotel and rooms are new, well decorated, perfect furnished and it seems a boutique hotel at a budget price (rooms are on ottoman style) 3. kind staff (staff is always kind and helpful. On departure they gave us a box of sweets and a box of the... we really appreciate it) 4. pc with internet connection available for free in the lobby - free wifi in the rooms 5. room was biger than expected (enough space for 2 persons!) this are the few negative aspects: - small breakfast room... sometimes you have to wait to get a sit (5 minutes not more) - double bed in the room is a queen size bed (a little bit smaller) - no swimming pool This hotel was perfect. It will be the choice for me, my parents, my family and all my friend on next trips to Istanbul !!! really a good choice!!! (Sapphire hotel and maywood should have the same owner as many commodities had the sapphire logo)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Csondy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location (Sirkeci), beautiful clean rooms, excellent staff, very good breakfast. Absolutely recommend to everybody, value for money! I've been at this hotel twice, but going back in June again!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Khalili999
Reviews.Content: Ideally located right in the middle of Sultanahmet, behind Sirkeci train station and 5 minutes walk (along the tram lines..you can't get lost) to the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia and the ferries. Staff are friendly and helpful and speak good English, a problem with my room was sorted out quickly..some of the rooms have no exterior windows and they get very warm. The air conditioning cannot be individually adjusted apparently. It can be a little noisy, you can hear the gulls crying when the ferries come in, but that was part of the charm. A nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Exploring the wonderful sights of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Juhannus
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with friendly staff. Good breakfast gives a powerful start for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul in Winter”
Reviews.Author: Eranda_11
Reviews.Content: Great value for money. Convienient Location & easy acess to all major sites in old istanbul. Rooms are bit small but well managed. Every day change of towels & bed sheets. Breakfast is quite ok & worth mentioning the varity of sweets. Staff is fairly ok & treat guests well. They allow me for early check in at 7am & late check out at 3pm. Only disadvantage is the lack of night clubs in the visinity. Generally this would applicable to all hotels in Old Istanbul. I wouldn't not hesitate to choose Maywood for my next Trip. Eranda

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: LuizCebola
Reviews.Content: Simple, but cozy and comfortable, this small hotel, located in the historic district (old town) of Istambul reflects with honor the same turkish hospitality you will find anywhere in the city. Although this part of the town is still being refurbished and reflects some mess, this little piece of art, opened in 2009, deserves a second look... specially if you consider the superb breakfast and the crewÂ´s hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “perfect base for a great week in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MikeinColumbia
Reviews.Content: The Maywood Hotel was an absolutely fantastic base for our week in Istanbul. Its location is excellent, centrally located near the Galata bridge, near a tram stop. The staff are helpful with excellent English. The room was, according to my wife, the cleanest she's ever stayed in, and we travel a lot. We had a double room (two twins) which was larger than anything we've stayed in Europe for comparable prices, with excellent shower and comfortable beds. The breakfast was amazing--bread, rolls, yogurt, jams, 5 kinds of olives, a dozen salads (turkish style), cold cuts,cheese, cereals, hard boiled eggs, etc., included in the room price. We fell in love with Istanbul and the Maywood is a big part of the reason. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent, reasonably priced, clean Hotel in Old City of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: pmsivalingam
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul in December 2010 for ca. 5 days and enjoyed our stay at Maywood Hotel, Istanbul. It is excellently located in the old part of Istanbul i.e. nearest in access to almost all slight seeing places in Istanbul, viz. The Blue Mosque, Sophia Museum, The Grand Bazaar, ect. all within a few minutes walking distance. The Hotel is also located very near to the tram system and surrounded by reasonably priced restaurants that are open late in the evenings, souvenir shops,etc. The Hotel is extremely clean with very friendly staff always there to help you with a friendly smile. You can certainly enjoy a very good hot bath that flows very well each day. An extremely spick & span Hotel. Additionally, an excellent full buffet morning breakfast is available FOC each morning to start the day fresh and strong for the going. A certainly moneys worth Hotel in Istanbul. Strongly recommend it to visitors to Istanbul. Further, the Hotel provides free reliable pick-up service from the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “superb value for money”
Reviews.Author: panosathens90
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying in maywood after extensive search in this site and I am glad i did so. -Ideally located 800 metres from spice bazaar and the galata bridge and a 2 minute walk upwards towards agia sofia and the blue mosque it permitted me to see everything with bothering with tram or taxi (although it has two tram lines that come throught one block from it). - The room -mine was at the first floor- was tastefully decorated, cleaner than clean, with a mini bar and an lcd tv (although you couldnt see it sitting in the bed). More importantly the wi fi was free and fast. -As i found out my last day there, there is a number of excellent restaurant 200 metres from it, best of which is the pasazade restaurant, serving ottoman cuisine (the best food i had during my stay there) My only complaint was regarding breakfast. It was extensive (ranging from turkish breakfast to cereal, croisants etc) and fulfilling to the eye, but I personally couldnt find anything to my liking Also, when I asked the night concierge where should i go for dinner around the hotel, he just said every restaurant in the area was of same value and that he could not reccomend anyone specifically.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: TomAce
Reviews.Content: They were absolutely correct. The offered Whirling Dervish ceremony / Hammam also were great. Great value for the money. The hotel is located in the central, at Gulhane stop. Just 5 minutes walk from Aya Sofia / Spice bazaar. It is clean the staff is absolutely polite. It is locate in a quiet street not on the main road. Breakfast is included, and on request they prepare omelet ;) At the check out they are giving some Turkish delight and tea set as a gift. This is a rare hotel as the room look like exactly the same in reality as at their home page.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value..”
Reviews.Author: Aylin186338
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small but very clean. Staffs are professional and very helpful. The lobby is well furnished. The room was very clean and well furnished with a bathroom that is very comfortable. The breakfast was above average (delicious Turkish style of breakfast). Hotel has a excellent location, it is just few meters of the most important touristic places like Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazard.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, impressive services”
Reviews.Author: IbizaLoveYou
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have returned from Istanbul last week for a 6 days vacation. We have spent a good time in Maywood hotel. When I booked, I read that there will be a complimentary pick up from the airport, and indeed, our flight was very early in the morning, the hotel driver was waiting to pick up directly to the hotel. We have checked in to our room early at about 7:00 am, even though the check out is at noon, and this is perfect. The hotel is small but very clean. Staffs are professional and very helpful, their English is good and they know the area very well. The lobby is well furnished. The room was cozy, clean and well furnished with a bathroom that is very comfortable, and a free fast wi-fi. The breakfast was above average with varieties of jams, honey comb, cheese, eggs, fruits, and some other Turkish dishes. Even though the hotel is in a back street, but it is in a strategic location, it is just few meters of the most important touristic places like Aya Sofia, blue mosque, Bayazit, Grand covered Bazard, and from the other hand, Eminonu, and the Bosporus. Moreover, there are 2 tram stations near the hotel, and a train station which makes the hotel very accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice, good value”
Reviews.Author: letgo
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our last two nights in Istanbul at this hotel. It was good value at 85 euros per night and has superior facilities to the Q-Inn, Sultanahmet, where we stayed for our first two nights at the start of our two weeks in Turkey. The Maywood is a small hotel with a lobby and professional staff. The room has polished floors and nice funrishings with a table and chairs to enjoy the complimentary Turkish teas. The shower is over the bath with good vanity bench space. There is a double wardrobe and space to put the bags, as well as an elevator to get them up the stairs to the room. The breakfast is magnificient and the free internet very useful. It was great being so close to the Spice Market and the Bosphorous ferries and the other main sights are only a ten minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, excellent location, and very good value”
Reviews.Author: Matthew085
Reviews.Content: A friend and I have just returned from a 5 day holiday in Istanbul, during which we stayed in this hotel. We wanted somewhere that had a good location and offered good quality accommodation for a reasonable price. Based upon the reviews on TripAdvisor we chose the Maywood Hotel, and we were extremely happy with it. The hotel is tucked away on a backstreet (the taxi driver struggled to find it, so worth having the full address with you), but is fairly large with a nice reception. We also quicly realised that the location is perfect for tourists, being a few minutes walk from the major tourist attractions (eg the Blue Mosque, the Aya Sofia, and various museums in the old city). The people on reception were extremely friendly and very helpful throughout our stay (talking us through the hotel's location upon our arrival and answering all our questions throughout the stay). The room itself was clean, spacious, with a good shower in the bathroom, a mini-bar, and a safe. There was also free wi-fi and a free computer with internet access available in reception. Breakfast was also good, with a full continental buffet along with traditional Turkish food. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in Instanbul!!”
Reviews.Author: leontini
Reviews.Content: We had a marvellous stay in Waywood Hotel. The staff was very very friendly and helpfull. Our room even though it was not so spacious, it was clean, nicely decorated and full of light. The location of the hotel is perfect for the sightseeing in Sultanhmet. I would recomment it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located, Reasonably Priced & Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: SabihaJunaid
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Maywood Hotel for five nights from 11/13 to 11/18/10. Our stay was comfortable and service was excellent. We enjoyed the breakfast and our site seeing experience became easy & comfortable because of central and convenient location of this hotel. We recommend Maywood Hotel as it was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel, good breakfast and fabulous care from staff”
Reviews.Author: television03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maywood for two nights and were very impressed with the level of care from the staff. We would definately recommend the hotel to friends. It is well placed in Istanbul and is near the electric tram. Very comfortable - will definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “cultural experience”
Reviews.Author: lola1604
Reviews.Content: great place to stay. in the old city with plenty of activity. free airport pickup which was very helpful. Able to walk to all sites of interest. breakfast plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best”
Reviews.Author: blueroose
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for 5 nights at this hotel in mid-November. This was my 3rd trip to Istanbul. I chose this hotel for the location, as it is in the middle of two Tram stops. This was such a great convenience. It's also walking distance to all the major tourist attractions. In terms of the room, the room sizes were as expected but the beds were not comfortable and the bathroom amenities (especially the towels and toilet paper, and there were NO tissues!) were always a problem. We were even given the room without any bed and bath linens and had to wait for them to be delivered - which were damp, so I think they were just taken out of the drier. No big deal, though. The breakfast was abundant and wonderful and well-maintained. Same goes for staff service. They really do aim to please. They also offer free wireless in all hotel rooms, which was nice to have. All in all, I would stay here again because of the location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Maywood is the perfect hotel to experience Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: lulumartini
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at Maywood based on a recommendation - and we couldn't have been happier with the accomodations. The room was very clean, the bed was comfy and the shower was great! We were very happy with the breakfast, which was a wide assortment of various fruits, breads, cheeses, eggs, potatoes, olives, juices, and of course Turkish tea! The location was easy walking distance from the major sites and attractions, as well as near many smaller boutique type shops and restaurants. The staff was friendly, professional and most helpful as well, and we couldn't imagine staying anywhere else when we return!! And, to top it off, it was a great value - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, good service!”
Reviews.Author: Christine189400
Reviews.Content: The location was fantastic, right behind the central train station, next to the sea & very close to Top Kapi, Aghia Sophia, the Basilica Cistern (Don't miss these 3!!!). The room was brand new in Ottoman elegant style. It was very clean with tea/coffee facilities. The view from the room was not something special but this was not a problem. What really disappointed me was the breakfast. I have never seen in my whole life such big quantities of everyhting but the quality was bad. Coffee was awful, too. Fortunately we were eating mini cakes (in packages).It is a pity for the hotel to spend so much money for breakfast which is bad. The service was very good, the receptionists were too willing to help us. Finally the price was very low & it included our transfer from the airport (very close to the hotel there are tourist offices that offer you transport to the airport - a mini bus picks you up from the hotel- at very good price. Don't take taxi)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: EulerVeloso
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well maintained, comfortable and enjoyable. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The front desk staff is very kind. The breakfast is very good. The location is excellent. The price is quite reasonable for what it offers. The next time we go to Istanbul, we will be there, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: johnnieb
Reviews.Content: what a great find, located just a couple blocks from the train station, easy walk to Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Underground Cisterns, and 10 minute walk to cross the bridge to "the other side" of Istanbul.. As others have noted, immaculate, well equipped rooms, with great bed and bedding, sparkling clean updated bath, extensive included breakfast, and a kind accomodating staff...all at a surprisingly reasonable price. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dukenukem30
Reviews.Content: The Maywood Hotel is fantastic. The photo description is exactly as described. On arrival, they had all our details and had our room available early. Also on arrival we were provided the hotel card which also includes the location and distance for the main visiting site and free WIFI. The room was clean, quiet and located in a great location. Close to all main sites, ATM and money exchange. The reception staff was excellent and friendly, likewise other staff we met. Good choice for breakfast. No hesitation staying at the Maywood Hotel again, likewise highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Position”
Reviews.Author: tripper37
Reviews.Content: An excellent 'boutique' hotel, close to the Sirkeci Station and with the Gulhane city tram line stop within 5 minutes walk. Topkapi Palace, Ayia Sophia and Blue Mosque all within easy walking distance too. Nice clean hotel, good rooms, good breakfast.. Plenty of good restaurants for dinner: left out of the hotel, left again, cross tramway and check out the options up side roads on right hand side.

Reviews.Title: “50-50 Depends on your needs”
Reviews.Author: syedahadali
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tiny. Like a tall building built among many others of the same kind cooped up in a lane. The rooms are very small. The bedsheets were clean, but the pillow covers very dirty. I asked the staff to change it and he was looking at me in bewildermnet saying they were clean. The bathrooms are okay, not much space to move around, but nice and clean. The breakfast was abundant. A lot of variety and the taste was also pretty nice. There is no restaurant and if you want room service, you have to order it beforehand. Bu they arranged an early breakfast for us on the day of our flight. The staff is nice and friendly and eager to help you. The location is okay, in the old city and very close to the Metro station. The restaurants close by are not very good though. Better go into the city to have better food. Overall, its a good choice if you are on a tight budget and prefer to stay in the old city. But if you are picky and like somethings mentioned above, choose a different one.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Maywood was delightful in every respect”
Reviews.Author: WSNCfolks
Reviews.Content: After a friends recommended the Maywood, we spent 4 nights there in SEPT 2010 and were pleased with every aspect of the hotel. The staff was helpful and the room we had was spotless! The location, with 300 yds of the Topkapi Sarayi or the Galata Bridge, is just great to walk to all the sites on the Old European/Golden Horn side of the city. I actually counted and there were 79 different items on the breakfast buffet. The hotel was just as represented on Trip Advisor. If ever in Istanbul again, we'll return to the Maywood. Don't miss the Chora church, the Archeology Museum, or the spice market ! After our 4 nights, we joined an INSIGHT 16 day 2,400 mile bus tour around Turkey........delightful to see the Roman, Greek and Turk history back to 5,000BC.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kartul
Reviews.Content: We had read a lot about this hotel, and expected it to be very good. And it was a very good hotel, especially compared to other hotels nearby where some of our colleagues were staying. The rooms were quite small, but comfortable and cozy. Breakfast was very good and the staff was helpful. Best of all is the location, close to all major sights. However, not everything was perfect. On arrival we found that a part of the shower wall in my colleagues bathroom was standing in the bathtub, something that the staff ought to have noticed. Also the wastepaper basket had not been emptied. The TVdid not work either, and even though a member of staff arrived promptly to fix it it still didn't work later that day. On arrival we were fetched by a free shuttle from the airport which was very nice, but when we asked in the reception about whether it was possible to book a shuttle for the return trip we were told that they didn't have any shuttle service, and were recommended a taxi. Later we asked another member of staff, and were now told that there was a shuttle service that we could book. I still recommend this hotel, but I think they should improve these things to get a five. The price of the rooms was very good, and compared to most other hotels in the area it is still a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Home in the Center of the Activities”
Reviews.Author: shri420
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I were guests at the Maywood Hotel for two weeks in late September/ early October. We had selected the Maywood on the basis of its location and reviews, and I can say that we were in no way disappointed. Once our booking was confirmed, the management wrote to ask about airline arrival and arranged for a free shuttle to the hotel. (And, later, probably because we were staying longer than most visitors, they kindly arranged a free return to the airport--at 3:30 am for an early departure!) The welcome at arrival was cordial and helpful. Our 'double room' was on the 4th floor facing the street, but when the window was closed, virtually no sound entered. "Double" in this case--as in other instances--meant two single beds. The hotel is in the Sirceji zone of the old city and like most other places, the rooms are not excessively large. However there was one chair and table, flat screen tv, ample drawers in the closet, a room safe and a mini-bar fridge that had enough slack room for us to store a few bottles of soda and Ayran--Turkey's marvelous yoghurt drink--very restorative after a day of tourism in hot weather! The bathroom was clean, with hair dryer, The tub and shower were effective, BUT the tub was high and its edge was higher due to the sliding shower panel. This could be a challenge for someone with mobility issues. It was the only problem I could see in the room. There is a free access computer in the lobby--though you have to get accustomed to a Turkish keyboard. We had a laptop and the hotel provides free 24 hour wi-fi that was highly satisfactory. The rate includes breakfast (7 to 10--but toward 9:30 the pickings could get slim). The selections were Turkish and Western and fresh and tasty. Many varieties of bread, rolls, muesli, cornflakes and another cereal, boiled eggs, usually one hot selection--vegetable or sausage; other meats, cucumbers, tomatoes, dried fruits, juice, filter coffee, turkish cay (tea) --also tea bags (and a hot milk urn). One caution which applies to virtually all Turkish places we went,--the concept of decaffinated coffee is not known--or else one gets instant Nescafe which did not seem very decaf to us. The staff at the Maywood were wonderful--helpful, courteous and friendly. We were not on a tour, and found our way around the city mostly on our own using the Akbil transit "key"--not always easy to find, but definitely worth using. The Maywood is close to the historic center--one can walk to Aya Sofia, Topkopi, Blue Mosque, Turkish and Islamic Museum, the Underground Cistern, the Grand Bazaar, the Spice Bazaar, the Rustom Pasha mosque and Sulimaniya mosque (tho that is closed for renovations at the moment). The tram line stations at Sirceji is about 2.5 blocks away in one direction and the Gulhane Park tram station is about 3.5 blocks in the other. Sometimes we used the tram to go up the hill to the Blue Mosque area simply to avoid the walk, but the walk is doable. Two blocks beyond Sirkeji are the ferry docks of the Eminonu neighborhood by the Galata Bridge--fish sandwichs are a must! Do you get the idea?--the Maywood is at the center of one of the most fascinating cities in the world. There are pleny of places to have a meal nearby--one of our favorites was the Grill House (est 1959) which has a Turkish name--located 1.5 blocks east and 1 block SE (at the big construction site which will be there for a while--no noise for us though). In short, we had one of the nicest holidays in our experience in Istanbul. It is a city no one should miss, and the Hotel Maywood was a perfect base for enjoying the visit. I noted that a number of shorter-term visitors were then joining or leaving cruises. On departure we each were presented with gifts--a small packet of apple tea mix with two tea glasses and a box of "Turkish Delight"---that was when we settled the balance of the bill the evening before departure. Early the next morning, the night manager wanted to give us two more! (In fairness, the Maywood's hospitality might be said to be not that unusual in Istanbul--most Turkish folks are very proud of their city and country and, even when they can't really solve a visitor's problem, will certainly try. The Maywood staff , however, seemed always to be able to provide the needed help.

Reviews.Title: “IF YOU COME TO ISTANBUL MAYWOOD IS THE WISE CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: abughazi2001
Reviews.Content: From the moment we reach to the airport and saw my name held by the shuttle driver,we felt relaxed.Upon arrival to hotel front disk people welcomed us in a warm manner and explained to me about the metro and the directions to the nearby attraction sites.Location of the hotel is superb where every thing you need is close to the hotel(blue mosque,topkapi,ayasofi.resturants and metro.) The room is very clean. Brekfast is marvellous and plenty with all turkish food and bread ,I liked the honey with its honeycomb and manykinds of turkish tea.Me and my wife decided to comeback to this hotel with our children next time. we left our luggage at the hotel for 4 days when travelled outside istanbul

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience overall”
Reviews.Author: AudreyWashington
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Maywood for five days and found the hotel to be a great bargain. It was conveniently located to restaurants, the tram, and major tourist sites. The hotel staff was wonderful, helpful, and friendly. The breakfast was a buffet of Turkish delights. Although the rooms were on the small side, they were very clean and comfortable and the decor was attractive, although modest. The front desk staff were so patient in responding to all of our questions and needs. Chico, the resident parrot, gave us many moments of pleasure during our stay. The Maywood would be my #1 pick if I am ever able to return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lce2
Reviews.Content: Maywood Hotel is a new hotel in the old part of Istanbul called Sireci which is a mixture of tourist hotels and locals. The hotel is on a side street very close to the tram route.
