They will arrange pickup for you from the airport free. The rooms are not large (in keeping with all hotels in the old part of Istanbul) but they are not pokey. They are well furnished with quality fittings and an attractive wooden floor. There is no restaurant in the hotel, but that isn't important as the area is surrounded by restaurants (some of the best in nearby hotels with roof terraces). There is a breakfast room and breakfast (which is included in the room rate) is very good with a large choice of dishes both eastern and western. The staff are friendly and very helpful (our luggage did not arrive at Istanbul with us and they were on hand to sort this out for us if needed.) It is clear from the moment you step over the threshold that the company cares about its guests. They even gave us a gift on departure (some turkish delight and some apple tea). The Maywood is a short walk to the main attractions of Istanbul (Ayia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi etc) and even closer to the Spice Market and the Grand Bazaar. It is an interesting area with shops making and selling turkish delight and all kinds of baklava. It is totally safe, day and night. The hotel is excellent value and I would have no hesitation in choosing to stay there again if in Istanbul in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful home away from home”
Reviews.Author: tusker03
Reviews.Content: The service we received at this hotel was outstanding! We were collected at the airport on time.A room was made available for early occupation as requested after a long flight.We were offered a breakfast on arrival and various offers of tea,coffee or other refeshments.The staff were attentive, always available to assist with all our needs. The room was beautiful,serviced early in the day and the beds so comfortable. You can see that this is a hotel run by a family who is proud of what they do.We were even presented with a gift when we left the hotel. Well Done Maywood Hotel

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: noshy
Reviews.Content: stayed at this wonderful hotel on a Page and Moy tour. Ticks all the boxes and we can confirm previous good reviews. Its the location that is perfect. You can walk anywhere in Old Istanbul, and we never felt threatened on the streets at night.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel five star service for a minimal price”
Reviews.Author: SydneyMaisie
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay and it was better than the first. We booked a double room but were given a triple (3 singles) which was great as the room was larger...if you don't mind not sleeping together it is worth it. Staff and service were just fabulous, polite helpful. Breakfast was great. Location ecellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value Hotel..”
Reviews.Author: sang32
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a superb location. Free Shuttle bus picked us up and communication with the hotel prior to our arrival was easy. Right on tram route and easy walking to all the tourist sites we wanted to visit. Lovely restaurants round the corner and found lots of nice bars down the side streets. On return trip book the 10 lira shittle from the guy outside Aya Sofya - bargain.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel for 3 star price, everything was fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: CameronsloveEurope
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have asked for better service from a hotel. The staff was friendly and tried to help us with any questions we had. The went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The breakfast was incredible with a large selection of both western and eastern dishes, fresh juices and delicious coffee. Our room was great with a nice, comfortable double bed. We'd like to send a special thank you to Vural Gundogar (apologies if spelled incorrectly) who greeted us every morning with a smile and a "hello". One evening he took us on a tour of the Sapphire Hotel (Maywood's sister hotel) and was so proud of it and all the renovations taking place. Would recommend the Maywood to any traveller visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: pantagruelParis
Reviews.Content: Over the last 45 years I've stayed, I suppose, at hundreds, literally, of hotels,and as a rule I tip on leaving (and arriving sometimes): room maids, porters mostly. But not until I stayed at the Maywood did I receive one on leaving, in the form of a box of Turkish Delight and a little apple tea set. On booking two single rooms I got a mail from the manager warning that such rooms were liable to be rather small. Well, each had three beds and was very decently sized. I can find almost nothing wrong with this splendid establishment. Well situated, very near a tram stop, in a quiet(ish) street. Polite and friendly staff. Free wifi. Splendid breakfast, even if the restaurant can be a bit cramped at rush hour because the furniture is so solid. Extremely reasonable rates: EUR 80 for a single through an online agency. Warmly recommended and would stay there again like a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: shefieldc
Reviews.Content: Great location in the original section of the city. Rooms are very clean and well appointed. Amazing continental breakfast. As with most European hotels in older areas, the rooms are a bit smaller but very nicely updated. Easy walk to the Mosques.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: highfeen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in this hotel. Rooms were good and clean. Tea and coffee every day. Most wonderful breakfast, beyond expectations. We had a wonderful time and could walk to almost every famous place . The tramway made it very easy to travel further and the ferries are at app. 15 minutes walk from the hotel. We recommend this hotel to travellers who like a quiet place and good rest after a busy day.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Rover82
Reviews.Content: I had initially planned to give a 3* for Maywood after the 1st night, but after staying there for 4 days, and due to the friendliness of the staff, I decided to give it a 4*. Maywood is one of few dozen hotels in and around the Sirkeci and Sultanahmet areas. My impression was that rooms were almost uniformly small in all hotels in that area and the main difference between the hotels was in the form of staff + breakfast quality. So Maywood hotel scored well in these 2 counts; Staff were generally friendly and helpful even though they seemed understaffed and as such, requests took some time to complete during busy periods. When we left the hotel, the front desk receptionist and the manager came over to the taxi and waved goodbye to us as the taxi drove off, a quite nice gesture that you wouldn't imagine in many 5* hotels. Breakfast was also good with a wide variety of food items (and fresh omelettes, something that many other hotels charge for in Istanbul). Location was excellent, the hotel was within walking distance to the Blue Mosque (15 minutes), the main tourist drag of Divan Yolu and the Eminonu pier. Did I mention the tram line was 2 minutes away as well? Sirkeci area provides a nice balance between the over touristy feel of some parts of Sultanahmet, and the completely non-touristy feel of Beyoglu, so it is often a good compromise for those unable to decide between Sultanahmet and Beyoglu for choosing a hotel. Rooms, as i mentioned, were small though clean. So if you want a no-frills room without any major issues in an excellent location, then Maywood may very well be your bet. However, if you want a spacious room, then be prepared to shell out 30-40 euros more for a 4 star hotel in Beyoglu

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: sshearer
Reviews.Content: The staff could not have been nicer. The hotel was very clean. The breakfast buffet was amazing - never saw such a selection of fresh foods before. Had to leave hotel on last day at 6:00 am for return flight and breakfast buffet was made available before we left. Room was a little small but very quiet. Received a very nice gift the day we left. Very nice and safe location for walking around the city and seeing all the sights. Would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “A Splendid Find”
Reviews.Author: Doreen8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. We had a twin room which was ample for the 2 of us. The location of the hotel was excellentand within walking distance of the main attractions. The hotel was spotlessly clean and our room was cleaned and sheets and towels changed every day. There was an extensive cold buffet breakfast with something there to suit everyones taste. The honey, from a honeycomb was the best I have ever tasted. The dinning room was spacious and quiet. What a joy. One super find was to go to the three golden boats next to the Galata bridge which served freshly cooked fish in salad rolls for just 4 Turkish lire. They were so good and fun to watch them being cooked. A place that we could have missed was the Saint Sophia which we felt was over rated and over charged at 20 Turkish lire a person compared with the Blue Mosque which was free. The hotel also provides a one way shuttle bus which was there to meet us at the airport, but going back it is easy to get a shuttle bus from any of the agents in town for 4 euros per person One thing to remember is to get a visa at the airport before queuing to go through immigration. I would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Missing that extra something..”
Reviews.Author: Ninde
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Maywood hotel for four nights in early September. Overall image of the hotel was nice, the reception area/breakfast room and the room itself was clean and tidy. The rooms are not that big in size, like mentioned on the previous reviews as well. But that was not a problem, in a city like Istanbul you don't really spend that much time in your room. The only thing that I would have liked to have was a view of the city! I would have liked to been able to see the beautiful city (even a small part of it) from our hotel room, the view that we had was for a small inner courtyard which was full of construction waste. Secondly the rooms have no soundproofing. You could hear neighbours listening on TV and also people talking on the corridors middle of the night. The location of the hotel is ideal for those seeking the touristic side of Istanbul, if you prefer something more authentic I would also suggest staying on the other side of the brige. I also did not find the helpfulness of the hotel staff as excellent as many have written here before. We asked several questions and always the answer was quite short similar to yes/no. But then again, we have always been able to find out stuff ourselves and had superb holidays - which was the case now as well. To summarize - Maywood hotel was okay for the price we payed and the location very central.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ErinPhelps
Reviews.Content: Three of us traveled to Istanbul for the first time for a Christian wedding, two parents and a 27-year old daughter. The bride was a Tufts PhD advisee of one of the parents and it was such a great opportunity to travel to a new city, with nearby contacts if needed. However, it was not needed because of the excellent staff and resources of Hotel Maywood. This hotel was one of two suggested by the bride and her family. The hotel was wonderful. The staff were available 24 hours a day -- good for jet-lagged guests -- and always warm and welcoming. They provided maps and directions, providing an indispensable tip to stay near the tram line for the first few days, so as to not get lost. We never took a cab during our 10-day stay because the public transportation was excellent and not hard to learn. The breakfast buffet was unbelievably good and ample. Be sure to check out the photos. And it was served 7-10 am on weekdays, but they never rushed you out. Access to a computer and to wi-fi was really helpful. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and well appointed. Quiet and restful. The location was fantastic as well. We were within a 5-10 minute walk to many things we wanted to see and the tram stop was less than 5 minutes away for destinations further away. I can't say enough good things about the hotel. Our room was a pleasant oasis in the middle of a huge and busy city. We are so glad we stayed here. I'll offer a couple of places to visit, outside of the usual sights. We went to Istanbul Modern, a museum of modern and contemporary art. and to Istanbul University on its fall registration day. Both afforded glimpses of the distinctions between modern and historical Turkey that we would not have had in only 10 days. We ate at two at the fish restaurants under the Galata Bridge, which were excellent. My favorite restaurant in this section of the city was Le Safran, which served Turkish food. And we liked the Arasta Bazaar behind the Blue Mosque and the Spice Bazaar better than the Grand Bazaar -- the Grand Bazaar is just too big! A great place to visit in this historical time, to see some of the effects of current events on everyday life. And, by the way, we were there during Ramadan and the 2010 World Basketball Championships. Although the basketball was televised in Turkish, it didn't really matter -- and it was fun to see some of our NBA players on their countries' teams.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: jbean68
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I only stayed at the Maywood hotel for one night as I was just passing through, but wish it could have been longer. I travel through Istanbul every couple of months and usually like to try out different hotels, but I think that this one is a keeper. Located just a 5-minute walk from either the Sirkeci or the Gulhane metro stops, this little gem was very quiet, impeccably clean, had wonderful service and an excellent breakfast. The price was also right!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ksa104
Reviews.Content: The Maywood Hotel is a very cute boutique hotel, and the staff was very helpful in fulfilling all of our requests and answering our questions. My room was clean and comfortable; however, it was also quite small, so there was not much space to move around/place our luggage. The location is a bit hard to find as it sits on a quiet street (and not all taxis know how to find it) -- so be sure to recognize your surroundings so you know how to get back! The rates were very reasonable and affordable, and they even offered us a 10% discount if we paid in cash upon our arrival. This is a nice hotel option, but if you are looking to be where the action is, I would suggest looking for a hotel in the Taksim area.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: andy_2005_2005
Reviews.Content: Nice furnished hotel in perfect localization very close to the most important points in Istanbul. Clean, well-equipped rooms, but very small. I recommend to take twin room instead of double (itâ€™s much bigger!). Very tasty and breakfast with a variety of food.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Yasino
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Maywood hotel in August 2010. The hotel is clean, staff are friendly and the services were good. I got all the services that were promised during reservation, and i think this is important. It is conveniently located as regards the attractions of the old city in Istanbul; within a short walking distance from the Blue Mosque. And if you would prefer the public transport, then the tram station at Sirkeci is just about a hundred meters away from the hotel. I had, however, some minor issues; like my room was quite dark, and there was some noise from nearby rooms. In spite of these minor issues, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling at an intermediate budget to Istanbul, as it is a good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: yattiyah
Reviews.Content: Maywood hotel was perfect for our 9-days long family vacation. The hotel was clean, cozy, with a very helpful staff who are keen to make all their guests comfortable and perfectly at home. Air conditioning was perfect for that time of year with relative high temperature and very high levels of humidity. Sheets and whites are changed on a daily basis, and breakfast was very good considering variety, freshness and quality. The location of the hotel is also perfect being 10 minutes away from main historical attractions and 5 minutes away from the tramway. Also a big plus the hotel has offered us airport pickup and drop off free service. I totally recommend this hotel looking for a comfortable vacation in Istanbul at a very good value!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for exploring the city, great service”
Reviews.Author: windsurfer121
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stopped stayed at Maywood hotel in Istanbul for 3 nites after spending 1 week in Alacati. The hotel is located in the old part of Istanbul town, and it's a really strategic base for visiting various historical sites such as the Topkapi palace, which is just 5 to 10 minutes walk away, and of course the grand bazaar. The train station and tram line is just a stone's throw away from the hotel, you could just hop on the train to the nearest shopping outlet Ovilium (hope I got the spelling right) 7 stops away, or take the tram to Taksim, another shopping area. The hotel room is small but very neat, tidy and clean, the shower stall was a bit small though. And there is the bed, we expected a King size, but was a bit disappointed that it felt somehow smaller than a queen ;-P Nevertheless, the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful indeed. They made us feel very much at home and comfortable. At this point, I must make a comparison between this hotel and the 5-star one which we stayed at Alacati, Maywood's service was by far better than that of the 5-star hotel ! It is really amazing how good service can make an average hotel an excellent one, and conversely, poor service can break a 5-star hotel. This is a true comparison to Solto hotel (5-star) which we stayed in Alacati for 1 week, the way the staff handled the check-in and how they treated their guests was not very professional, although it was a nice hotel, we did not feel at home and service provided by this 5-star hotel, which didn't come close to the service we got from Maywood hotel Well done to the staff at Maywood hotel! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: loindela
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and staff,it was really so clean and near to many attractions and tram station. Very Good Breakfast,and under the attention of Mr Ihsan. Excellent Staff ! Thank u very much guys:Mehmet,Ender,ihsan,Evsen ! See u next time !

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in the center of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Alby80
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the center of Istanbul, few minutes walking by the Aya Sophia and Blue Mosque. Rooms are very clean. Breakfast is variuos and well cooked. Staff is helpfull and kind. They give me a free shuttle from Ataturk airport because I stay there more than 3 nights. If I will return to istanbul (and I think i will do), I surely return to Maywood's.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: humaLahore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 10 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. It is ideally located, in close proximity to the major tourist attractions and the tram and the bus stations. Our rooms (201 and 301) were spacious enough, clean and very comfortable. These were maintained daily. The buffet breakfast had a good variety and tasted very well too. The staff at the reception as well as at the breakfast was very courteous and hospitable. We were very warmly welcomed upon our arrival and greeted with a drink, sweets and a small souveniour. The gift on our departure was also a very pleasant surprise. Overall the ambience was very homely and pleasant. We loved our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mandlNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: I'm going to make this easy for anyone wanting a recommendation for a hotel in Istanbul. Book this one! Fab location, helpful staff, great breakfast, beautiful rooms......could not find one complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: jm8421
Reviews.Content: The Maywood is very conveniently located near the tram and most of the old city sites. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel has been recently remodeled and was very quiet and clean. A special plus was that the air conditioner was capable of turning our room into a refrigerator in a very short time. The Maywood was a little hard to find, because the street numbering is being/was changed in early July. The new number is 15, not 25.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: GazBristol
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Maywood for 5 nights at the end of June this year.When i arrived i was met by the very polite receptionist who swiftly checked us in with the minimum of fuss,while he checked us in the other receptionist went and got us a lovely cold fruit cocktail just what you need after a long flight.The porter then took our cases and escorted us to our well appointed room. The hotel staff during our stay was very helpful nothing was any trouble. The location could not be better 5-10 mins walk from all the tourist sights in the old part of the city.STAY AT THIS HOTEL ,BEST VALUE,BEST LOCATION

Reviews.Title: “If you don't stay at Maywood, You lost out on the best hotel in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: MaherFlorida
Reviews.Content: Maywood hotel and staff were the best. Even before leaving the US we were in correspondence with the hotel manager and he set everything up for us from the time we arrived at the airport. The shuttle staff were very friendly as well. We are a family of 5 traveling throughout Turkey and they did everything they could to make our stay special. We even returned for our last 2 days in the country to this hotel without a reservation and they charged us 10% less than what we paid in the beginning. Engin, the GM was very helpful and friendly. If you need any help or have any problems, he wouldn't hesitate to help and make you happy. The front desk staff were helpful. They do provide a small map for free. They escort you and your luggage to the room. Breakfast is very good ( Turkish breakfast ) nice verity of food, fruits and drinks. So for the Value it's a bargain. I hope you find my review helpful and enjoy your stay at the Maywood hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: manosandr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Maywood Hotel in June 2010. The hotel ofeered us a free transfer from the airport to the hotel, which was very helpful. The front desk of the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Maywood hotel is very near Sultanahmet area (5 mins walking) on a quiet street. Room and bathroom were very clean and they cleaned them every day! Breakfast was very good and rich. Generally is a new hotel with very good stuff. If you book early, you can find really good prices for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Tarja_Helsinki
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 days and 5 nights in Istanbul in June and not for the first time. Maywood is the best hotel we have had in Istanbul and in Turkey also. Rooms are beautiful, always well cleaned and well equipped. Lovely bath room! Very comfortable beds, easy to sleep. I really miss Maywood's fantastic buffet breakfast: many tastefully decorated tables full delicious food. We also want to thank Vural for all his help! Desk was always willing to help, even borrow their own akbil :) Can service be any better? We got presents when we left, thank you very much! I absolutely recommend this hotel to all my friends and all travellers. Also location in Sirkeci is central: we used public transportation to many places: KadikÃ¶y, Aksaray, Taksim, Fatih (interesting a bit religious suburb).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterRashed
Reviews.Content: I would definitely suggest the hotel for the following reasons. - Very friendly and helpful staff. - Absolutely clean and quite luxurious furniture and bathroom. - Excellent breakfast. However, finishes at 9 or 9:15 am. - Very good location- 1 minute walking from two tram stations, 7 minutes walking from the Blue Mosque. - Free Wi-Fi in the rooms and the lobby. ALL of that with an unthinkable low prices.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: cjparsons
Reviews.Content: Lovely place - great location, staff are friendly and very helpful, excellent food and great value. My partner and myself spent 10 days there in June 2010 and I would not hesitate to give this hotel my highest recommendation and will stay there again the next time I am in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and friendly place in the middle of busy Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: JayceeBergen
Reviews.Content: I had a good stay at the hotel. Staff were excellent and friendly. Breakfast was amazing and a good overview of what I could expect in the rest of my trip around Turkey. Hotel was clean and comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “A Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: TwoGuysCalgary
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on Trip Advisor and thanks to great reviews booked our stay here and were not disappointed. This hotel is very clean, modern and in a great location. We could walk to Haghia Sophia, the spice market and the Grand Bazaar. The rooms were very clean and modern with excellent beds and linen. The staff were most helpful and even gave you a gift on our departure. The whole expereince at the Maywwod was a delight. Great price very good value for money and breakfast was included and very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good people Good location”
Reviews.Author: sachebo
Reviews.Content: Spend 3 nights in Maywood Hotel with 3 friends. The hotel is conveniently located just a few mins from Sirkeci station. Staff are friendly and helpful. Wifi connection does not work in our room though, we had to use the internet in the lobby, but it does not cause too much trouble. We were told that the room would be a bit small since it is located in the old town, but our triple room was large enough for our comfort. We bascially visited most of the sights on foot, the walk from the hotel to the grand bazaar was around 20 mins, and it was a pleasant walk. The thing that impressed me most in Turkey is the friendliness of its people. A very good example is the shop owner of the resturant and bar opposit to Maywood hotel, which is why I also recommend anyone who is staying in Maywood to go to the waterpipe bar opposite to the hotel for a drink and have a chat with David, who will surely provide you with useful tourist information.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly little hotel in old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: YYZErnie
Reviews.Content: I was to stay at the Maywood's sister hotel, the Safir, but as they were fully booked, instead, I stayed at the Maywood. After getting off a 10 hour, overnight flight from Toronto, the hotel staff were good enough to pick me up at Istanbul airport and deliver me and the others on my flight through the maze of small streets in old Istanbul first to the Safir, and then to the Maywood. The rooms in the Maywood are small (but aren't they all are in this part of the city). They are, however, very clean, air conditioned, and the bed was very comfortable for the 3 nights I was there. For the very reasonable price of 65 Euro, the hotel includes a breakfast buffet and wireless internet. And the staff are happy to call you a taxi, suggest a nearby restaurant for dinner or just help get you out and about in the old city. As well, the staff all seem to have a fairly good command of English. If I were to ever go back to Istanbul, I'd certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jorgeceb
Reviews.Content: Familiy of four, with two teenagers, stayed in early June 2010. Maywood staff is very friendly, and service oriented, that helped made our trip to Turkey a very special one. The four person bedroom is not huge, but very clean and adequate for all four. Location in Sirkeci is perfect, between Sultanhamet and the new town and just couple of blocks from Sirkeci Tram Stration. Mid-priced restaurants in parallel street behind Maywood. Buffet breakfast is very Turkish, lots of vegetables, fruits, mermelades and cold cuts for us tourists. Example of good service, for our two day trip to Capadoccia at 5am they unexpectedly had four sandwiches wrapped and prepared for our trip before we got in the taxi cab. You might get that in a Four Seasons. Examples of convenient location, on our day trip to Ephesus, we took the very safe Metro/Tram back to hotel from Ataturk Airport to Sirkeci Station just two blocks from hotel. 45min trip cost only US$8 (4 people) instead of US$45 with a Taxi. Also, Maywood is a nice 10minute walk to the wonderful Sultanahmet Park (Aya Sofia etc.) and Old Town; 20 min walk to Beyoglu Tunnel Funicular (acroos Galata Bridge); 20 min walk to Bosphorus Boat; 20 min walk to Grand Bazaar. Istanbul and Turkey is very safe so don't be afraid of walk around or take the metro/tram service. In all locations that we visited, English is only fairly spoken, so be patient, Turkish people are very friendly!!!! I recommend this hotel to families, couples and business people for the Great Value Equation (Good Location + Good Service + Very Clean + Good Price).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel tucked away in the old town of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: 100of10
Reviews.Content: We would like to thank everyone at Maywood hotel for making our stay home away from home. Staff treated us like family, the variety of breakfast was well worth it. All attractions were a short walk away. Our room was very well maintained and clean. Most of all the staff kept us entertained throughout our stay and were very sad when we had to leave they even packed us a small lunch when we hit the road to the next city. Definitly i would rate this hotel a 10 of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: NKL2010
Reviews.Content: The Boutique Maywood Hotel was a lovely hotel ideally situated close to many of Istanbul's major sights, only a couple of blocks to the tram, and close to a huge number of restaurants. The staff was very accommodating, and had helpful suggestions for meals. The room was beautifully decorated, and the beds comfortable. The bathroom was very clean. Breakfast had a wide variety of choices - and freshly squeezed orange juice. The hotel seemed to normally be very quiet, but one night the restaurant across the street was a quite noisy. Just ask for a room away from the front. Be sure to pick up the inexpensive Istanbul map available in the Lobby in a variety of languages - we used ours until it fell apart. I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay at the Maywood Hotel in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: localgirl020
Reviews.Content: The Maywood Hotel was conveniently located and within walking distance of many important sites. The hotel was clean, the staff was courteous and helpful, and the cost was very affordable. We also enjoyed a delicious breakfast buffet at the hotel including freshly squeezed orange juice!

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: MCassatt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Sirkeci, near to Gulhane Park and the tram line. Everything in the main Old City area is within walking distance for a normal, reasonably active person (about 10 minutes to Aya Sofia; another 10 minutes to the Spice Bazaar; maybe 20 minutes to the Grand Bazaar). As female travelers, me and my companions felt perfectly safe and comfortable in the area around the Maywood and in the hotel itself. Our room was great - we stayed in triple rooms the whole time we were in Turkey, and the Maywood had the only room specifically designed to house 3 people comfortably. The hotel was renovated not long ago, so everything is still new and clean, and the elevators are reliable. The included hotel breakfast was very good, and the restaurant manager greeted us himself with fresh squeezed orange juice. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and routinely went beyond the call of duty without prompting. There is always someone with good English at the front desk to assist English speaking tourists. The hotel also has good free wifi. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find”
Reviews.Author: rrustler
Reviews.Content: Tucked away, near all the action is this fine establishment. Small, personal, great breakfast, and to crown it all a FREE airport pick up if you stay 2 nights. A must if you have not been to Istanbul before.

Reviews.Title: “You won't regret this choice”
Reviews.Author: AlohaWanderer
Reviews.Content: We just returned from two nights at the Maywood Hotel and everything I read on TripAdvisor about the Maywood is true. The staff, the location, the rooms. Very clean and suprisingly large. We stayed in the triple that is pictured on the website. Though things are not the five minutes, more like fifteen minutes, away, we walked to the hotel from the Grand Bazaar, the Spice Bazaar. Everything else was fairly close. I thought that the breakfast buffet was outstanding. We had toured much of the south west of Turkey and enjoyed many buffets, this one was the best. We even had fresh squeezed orange juice; the chopped veggies were especially tasty (see picture). The staff was most helpful, making reservations for us at a restaurant. My travel mates may want to write their own reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: MarkBeWell
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable double room. Requested that the two separate beds be made into one larger bed, no problem. Nice bathroom with adjustable shower and tub. Just be careful getting in and out of the tub, since it is rather tall. Good location, within walking distance of Sultanehmet sights. The entire staff is very helpful and accommodating. Special thanks to Engin, Endar, Mehmet, and Vural. Vural is justly proud of the breakfast buffet, which he supervises. We've added a few pictures for those who look forward to breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: javiviva
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel if the rate is low. I happened to find a very good deal and paid less than the original cost. The hotel facilities are great, the rooms are very clean, the bathroom is very comfortable, nice shower. The staff is very kind and they were willing to help us in any way we needed. The breakfast is very complete, The location is very good, around the corner there are a lot of nice restaurants, very hippie style, which I loved. The train station is two blocks away. The blue mosque, and aghia sophia is like 10 blocks far, but you get very easily following the train lines. the grand Bazaar is a little bit far, you can take the train or walk 20 blocks I think may be less, depending the street you take. I would like to say a few things about this hotel that you should know, so you don't get any surprises once you are there. The lady that cleaned our room entered the room without knocking, with us inside, two different times. in one of them we had the non disturb sign on. It wasnt that bad, we were just relaxing. Many times we found this lady sitting in the floor next to our door with the door of service opened. sometimes we found tea cups and dishes in the floor and the cleaning cart. I think a four star hotel should not allow this things happen. There was internet wi fi but it didnt work in my room, i had to use it in the stairs or the hall. We took a tour to the bosforus (highly recommended by the way) offered by the hotel, it was perfect until the end of the tour in which we spent half an hour to go to some place, and when we realized we were in a tourist trap, they left us in a place where a fashion show took place with women dressed in leather. we couldnt believed what was happening, all of our free afternoon was being wiped out from our plans. after this fashion show they were going to some other place to drink some tea and after that they were leaving people at some point, not the hotel. we talked to our guide that we where very angry at this, and we wanted to leave. he was very nice and paid for a taxi to our hotel. we lost only an hour and could finally do what we wanted and went to the pedestrian street. I recommend you to ask your guide what are you going to do next, so you don't go through with this. We made reservations for the shuttle to go to the airport, and when the time came, there was a taxi waiting for us. they told us the van was not available that day.... The taxi took a high speed street and reached the 120 kph. We were going to the airport with a lot of time and I told him to slow it down, we were very nervous, there is no need to be stressed out when you are relaxing. I hope this review helps and prepares you for a very nice vacation. Enjoy istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in good location with delightful staff”
Reviews.Author: Speaks_Texan
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the Maywood Hotel for a leisure trip to Istanbul. I had originally selected the location as it is close to the railway station. However, the Maywood contracts with a service to pick you up at Ataturk; so, no need for the railway system. We were given a spacious and clean room. The hotel staff took the time to explain the satellite TV system (which my clicking husband soon messed up.) The staff immediately came back and cheerfully gave us another orientation. The staff was always making sure you were comfortable. I was sitting at the public computer one afternoon when the bar man asked if he could get me some tea or coffee and he used the best expression, "on the house.". When we left, we received a present from the staff. That was so gracious. All in all, the Maywood was a delightful experience

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Spot to Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: msumma
Reviews.Content: The Maywood has a wonderful staff who are very helpful. A special thanks to Orhan and Burhan for making my stay at the Maywood so enjoyable. The Maywood is located on a quiet street very close to all the tourist sites in Sultanahmet. Also, there are two tram stops very close to the hotel and the train station is about a five minute walk. My room had a balcony overlooking the street and was very comfortable and quiet. Breakfast was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel and staff:-)”
Reviews.Author: Indra2121
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel is excellent, only some minutes from the main sightseeing places and not on the main street. We have nice triple room with good decoration. Staff is extremely responsive. Very convenient is a shuttle to/from airport what offers a hotel! We have been twice in Maywood hotel and I hope we will return there again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities, obliging staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: kilbrannan
Reviews.Content: A great small hotel ideally located to visit the tourist spots of central Istanbul. It is nearly new, clean and hard to fault. The staff are prepared to help in anyway they can. Having booked out we returned to the hotel as our flight was cancelled due to the Volcanic Ash crisis. They found us a room and allowed us to spend some time using the facilities waiting for an overnight train leaving Istanbul after we had booked out. I can highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “TheÄ±r staff Ä±s superb and goes out of theÄ±r way to be helpful so that you wÄ±ll enjoy thÄ±s great lÄ±ttle hotel.”
Reviews.Author: plumosago
Reviews.Content: EverythÄ±ng here deserves a hÄ±gh ratÄ±ng. The hotel has been nÄ±cely refurbÄ±shed. The staff Ä±s both frÄ±endly and professÄ±onal. The hotel Ä±s clean and convenÄ±ently located. My husband and I travelled together but I would feel safe stayÄ±ng here alone. The mattresses are new and comfortable and the breakfast Ä±s generous. We lÄ±ked Ä±t so much that we changed our reservatÄ±ons for our return through Istanbul so that we could stay here agaÄ±n. We were not Ä±nterested Ä±n fÄ±tness center, conference room, room servÄ±ce, pets or parkÄ±ng so we dÄ±d not ask about these amenÄ±tÄ±es. Breakfast (generous and good) Ä±s served Ä±n a dÄ±nÄ±ng area but I do not thÄ±nk they serve other meals there but they probably could.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay in old city, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Lisaman
Reviews.Content: We originally intended to book Sapphire Hotel as recommended by so many travellers at Tripadvisor.com. However, we were not comfortable providing credit card information over email and did not fill out the reservation form as required. Upon arriving at the Sapphire Hotel, we were told all rooms were booked. But the front desk was kind enough to recommend us to Maywood instead. It was a great recommendation! Maywood hotel is just close by in the middle of all tourist attractions. Service was excellent and the buffet breakfast included in the room rate was great! Great value! I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: Milu30
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. They were very friendly and helpful. The hotel location is perfect, close to the everything.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bisonfantaic
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Maywood based on other positive reviews. We fully endorse all the other favourable comments. The location is excellent , the service good, the breakfast excellent and the room comfortable. My tip would be to have twin beds as the doubles look very small (unless you like it very cosy ofcourse!) and the walls are quite thin BUT it is clean, includes hairdyers, kettles, fridge and comfy beds. I would return and certainly recommend it. Our transport to the hotel was included but our return journey was organised efficiently by the front desk. At 90 euros a night for two in April this was a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful place in the most wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: NetherlandsAnonymous
Reviews.Content: The staff of this beautifull hotel don't just make you feel at home, they make you feel so wellcome and their very special guest as well! The location of the hotel is perfect in every way, close (walking distance) to all the sites you would want to visit and close to the different means of public transport, (which are excellent in this city), without the noise and hectic feel off being in such a big city! Every morning the rich breackfast was a feast, a perfect way to start the day. The rooms were kept very clean every day and I slept like a princess in the comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff, nice location and good price”
Reviews.Author: Zuban
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Maywood Hotel for 6 nights as their sister hotel, the Hotel Sapphire, was fully booked. As soon as we arrived the staff went out of their way to help us out, from offering good advice on places to see and eat to the now well-known gifts on leaving. The breakfast was also very good with a good variety of tasty food, including cold meats, bread, fruit, olives, cereal, etc. The rooms were nice, and of decent size. The TV had a lot of channels but only a few are english and you're not there to watch TV anyway! We were given a room on the road and so long as you keep the balcony door closed you'll have no noise issues from the road (which is a noisy road throughout the night). The rooms were always very well cleaned and prepared for our return. The Internet WIFI access was excellent from our room - always on and always fast. Unfortunately there were some cons - the walls between the rooms are a little thin and you can hear neighbours if they are noisy, or the TV is turned on slightly loudly, or sometimes the plumbing shall we say. The same goes for the cleaners and staff in the corridors who could be very easily heard early in the morning which disturbed our sleep more than once. In terms of location I know many say it is excellent, which it is, particularly for getting to the port at Eminonou (and getting to the tourist freer areas on the Asian side!) and the Topkapi but Istanbul is full of hotels and you can get hotels in nicer areas closer to the Sultanahmet. However, the price will not match that of the Maywood. All in all certainly a good stay, and would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: seahawksteve
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? This place absolutely rocks! The staff is superb and will do anything to make you happy! The buffet breakfasts served there are beyond excellent! Every morning I looked forward to them. The location is as prime as you are going to get, only steps away from the waterfront and a moderate 10 minute walk up to the Haga Sophia and Blue Mosque. The rooms are EXTREMELY comfortable and very clean! They seem to go to great lengths to keep the rooms clean. If you want a really fun experience, be sure to ask for a room with a balcony!! The price and location cannot be beat!!!! You will not regret your stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, well located and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at three hotels over 11 days in Istanbul. We stayed three nights at Maywood Hotel, and we rate it second among the three, confirming TripAdvisor member ratings. Maywood is owned by Sapphire Hotel. They had no freezer in the Maywood Hotel but they were able to freeze our ice packs in the Sapphire Hotel and bring them to the Maywood when we checked out. They had no scale so we had to estimate the weight of our suitcases before going to the airport (we underestimated and regretted not bringing back more). Every day that we came back to the hotel after 12 noon, we found our key cards didnâ€™t work, and we had to go back down to the reception desk to have them re-coded. We saw others doing the same thing. We paid Euro 90 per night less 10 per cent for cash. They provided free transfer to the airport (because they didnâ€™t have to pick us up at the airport), and they gave us a free Turkish delight and tea plus glasses when we left. Location Walking distance to Egyptian Market, piers at Eminonu and Sultanahmet. Nearest to Gulhane tram station. Walking distance to TripAdvisor member top-valued restaurants such as Imbat, Pasazade, Neyzade. Lots of souvenir stores along Hudavendigar Street. Room Small but clean-looking room. Elevator provided access to all floors. Heat was available all the time by hot air, and it felt good on those cold evenings. Air conditioner and heat vent faces bed. Pillows and mattress were the most comfortable of the three hotels. Maid refilled soap. Have to buy your own water. Coffee maker available with different kinds of tea. In-room safe. Very pretty new Turkish carpet in hall. â€œDo not disturbâ€� and â€œmake up roomâ€� lights operated even if key card not in slot. There was no Jacuzzi, but the bathroom furnishings were very good. TV had more English language channels but not many--mainly news and fashion. No view. Room 309 looked out onto the backs of other buildings. Internet access There was none. In-room wi-fi had excellent signal strength but limited or inaccessible status. We had to wait for every website but Google. Wait ranged from 5 minutes to eternity. After you logged in, the wait was closer to eternity or â€œthis page cannot be displayed.â€� We think there are too many users on the network. The free public computer in the lobby had a Turkish keyboard and was comparatively slow, but it got a virus on our first night and wasn't fixed by the time we left. The three computers used by staff had good fast Internet connection. The staff kindly let us use the manager's computer on one occasion, and they kindly printed our boarding passes. Internet in a nearby shop is TL 2 per hour. Quiet enjoyment No external noise (faced other buildings), but lots of internal noise. The walls and doors conduct sound most efficiently. . We turned up the TV volume to drown out the sound of the two men next to us talking against the wall by our bed until they fell asleep (when we could hear one of them snoring). A hotel man opened the door to our room without knocking. Turned out he was filling the minibar of another room, not ours. Staff Staff are very friendly and helpful. They do very well even though they are very busy at times. The hotel is near the Sirkeci train station, and many travelers come from the station to stay at the Maywood. Breakfast Wonderful with fresh squeezed orange juice provided on ground floor behind reception. Best selection of the three hotels where we stayed: more selection of jams, spreads. Always hard boiled eggs, and could order eggs prepared any way you wanted. Good service in the breakfast room Maywood offered good value, but it will be more valuable to someone who does not rely on regular in-hotel Internet contact and who is lucky enough not to have loud neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Maywood Hotel - polite staff, clean room.”
Reviews.Author: MButle
Reviews.Content: First of all it is in an excellent location. The staff were helpful and polite. Although the room was on the small side it was very clean here. The bathroom was nice though and had a great shower. We did not try the breakfast so I am unable to comment on that. There was a strange semll in the lift at times not that itfollwed us to the inside of our room. There is satellite TV but there wereonly two or three English speaking channels amongst the hundreds available. They gave us a charming present of apple tea and some glasses along with some Turkish Delight wehn we departed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, high quality hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MiddleagedSuffolk
Reviews.Content: A modern, clean, comfortable and quiet hotel in an excellent location with all the main places to visit in easy walking distance. Also close to the train station, boat terminal and trams. Staff are friendly and helpful and nothing is too much trouble. Breakfast is excellent and all facilities are first class. We had a wonderful time and would thoroughly recommend the Maywood Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Maywood! You won't regret it!”
Reviews.Author: tickita
Reviews.Content: Could not have had a better experience with this hotel. The rooms are great, very clean, comfortable, and have everything you need: minibar, free wireless, safe deposit, tv. The staff goes out of their way to make you happy. Always smiling, helping you with directions. The location is amazing. Walking distance of the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia and also super close to the tram line which takes you to the centre of the city very quicky. And the price is the price of a hostel in Europe. Stay here! I'm positive you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: analopez84
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful and the hotel itself is great.

Reviews.Title: “this is more than Ä± pay”
Reviews.Author: john_265
Reviews.Content: I liked location and hospitality of staff most.Rooms and Hotel is very clean, I have learned that Hotel constructed recently one year ago.They have helped me to arrange flight tickets,transportation. it is close to sea and historical places just by walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: FrancaM
Reviews.Content: Extremely clean, comfortable and centrally located, staff goes out of their way to make guest happy. Good bkfst but needs some more international flare. Beautiful rooms, a bit on the small side. Air conditioning system can be improved a bit

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay in a mesmerizing city of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: levy30
Reviews.Content: Due to my very frequent business trips in recent years I have travelled so many places and stayed in so many different hotels. Most of the places I have stayed so far in Istanbul were very good however this hotel has ticked all the correct boxes for me. It is located in the middle of old city of Istanbul and only a few minutes of walking distance to business centers, historical and cultural attractions. I feel so lucky to stay in this recently developed boutique hotel in the middle of old city. All the staff and management team were so friendly, welcoming and helpful. As I mentioned it was very recently refurbished and there was lot of attention paid to minor details. My bed was very comfortable and room was very clean. Hot water was available 24 hours and water pressure was very good too. Despite the hotel is being located in the middle of old city there was hardly any noise from outside during night time. Breakfast room was very spacious, clean and not crowded. I have been spoiled with great range of Turkish food. Everything was fresh and absolutely delicious. And serving staff was very helpful and alert. One other point that I wish to point out is, I also had time to use Turkish bath, Sauna and Jacuzzi facilities in Maywood's sister hotel which is literally two minutes of walking distance away. Once again there was no disappointment of the quality of service, cleanliness and hygiene. Everything was excellent. I would definitely recommend this place to all my friends, family and my business contact. If you are just planning a trip to Istanbul whether it is a business trip or a romantic weekend away this is the place to stay and enjoy. Once you experience the hospitality of this place, you will feel like at home. I wish you all a great time in this historical and magical place.

Reviews.Title: “I NEVER leave reviews....”
Reviews.Author: AnotherLovelySunset
Reviews.Content: I am, to be modest, really well travelled. I never leave reviews for hotels because I'm always just content with my stay. I've never been so extremely surprised at the generosity, hospitality and general kindness of a hotel as I am with the Maywood (and surely it's sister hotel, Sapphire, would be a similar case) I cannot say much that hasn't already been said about this hotel, but I do want to note that the water pressure in the shower was FANTASTIC and the bed was firm and sooooo wonderful. I don't even sleep that comfortably at home! I have to guess that the rooms at this hotel are of different sizes because ours was HUGE! I could have easily invited 5 other people up for drinks had I been traveling with friends. Lots of floor space and extra chairs for sitting space. It was great. Request room 304 if this is important to you ("french beds" is what they called it, but it was one queen-sized mattress.) We've included photos so be sure to check out the photo tab. My husband is 6'3" (190cm) and had no complaints about the size of the bed or shower cabin - you can see him sitting in a chair in one of the photos. For what we paid per night (just a bit more than some nearby youth hostels) this hotel met and exceeded our expectations. Upon arrival, we were greeted by the very friendly and knowledgeable Emol. Despite having only studied the english language for four months (I don't believe it!!!) he asked how our journey to the hotel was and if we found it without problems. {{We flew into Sabiha Airport and so were not offered a free pick-up service. Anyway, you can just hop on the Havas bus headed to Taksim and for 13 TL or 7 euro per person, make it to town in about an hour. From there, you would take the Kabatas funicular downhill for 1.50TL, then the connecting tram for another 1.50TL and exit at Sirkeci. Cross the road (carefully!) and head uphill, taking the second left. Please consult google maps because there are lots of little streets, alleys and passageways.}} Emol then offered us a welcome drink and some Turkish Delight then took a map, explained where we were and oriented us with the surrounding areas and things to see. We were led up to our room (reachable by one of the two elevators or a staircase) and explained what everything was and how it worked (the rooms and hotel have quite a few high tech details...like a sound system in room bathrooms and a doorbell for each room!!) Breakfast was served by Mr. Vural from 7am-10am each morning with coffee, tea, hot water, warm milk and cold juices and water. I believe you can order extra drinks, but we didn't need them. An assortment of pastries, fresh and dried fruits, cucumbers, tomatoes, cheeses, deli meats, olives, yogurt, bread, spreads, cereals and sweets are on offer. Though not what we normally eat for breakfast, we found it to be extremely filling and a nice glimpse into the Turkish lifestyle. Vural will take good care of you at breakfast....rest assured. Use this early morning time to really savor what Istanbul offers - and pick Vural's brain for any and all information you may need! He was truly and open book. We talked to him about the Turkish people, politics, religion, the economy, our safety as tourist (he was very frank about everything, as well...no BS...which was very much appreciated.) The hotel is literally meters away from the Topkapi palace walls. The staff are more than willing to help you with learning Turkish words and phrases, drawing maps (!!!), sharing their opinions and also just open to a little chat every now and then. There is a computer in the lobby with free access, as well as the free wi-fi throughout the hotel. There are restaurants nearby (we ate at the colorful "Clas Restaurant" on M. Hudavendigar Cad. the first night and received huge portions for very little money...no tourists were there, perhaps that's why? You can also buy 12 postcards for 1TL on the same street, FYI. At the Grand Bazaar they were 4 for 2TL.) Please contact me if you need any further details, but don't be weary about booking. This was a beautifully decorated, clean hotel, with great staff, in a perfectly situated area at a fraction of the price of touristy locations like Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly staff, nice rooms but the area where the hotel is located is not that good...”
Reviews.Author: schokokuh
Reviews.Content: The staff at Maywood Hotel is really exquisitely friendly and the rooms are nice, clean and it is very silent at night. One negative point is that they did not turn on the radiotor so it was quite cold at night. The area where the hotel is located is a bit battered and at night everything is closed there. I did not feel well when I went home at night. I would not recommend this hotel for lone travelling women because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but comfy and luxurious stay”
Reviews.Author: dtshin
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, with new and modern rooms. Our room faced the street and the curtains kept on coming undone - but it was fixed quite quickly. The staff were friendly and quite helpful - although they looked young. The free WiFi helped, as we could plan our trips and find out information about where to go/what to do, etc. The breakfast is quite simple - you could skip it for food in the area. Location is so-so, as in the evenings, it is somewhat quiet when the tourist attractions shut down, but it is walkable to/from the tram line stops (and from the train station). It is quite walkable to the tourist attractions, too.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: deboraGreece
Reviews.Content: i was really impressed by the cleanliness of the room and the location of the hotel! the staff was very friendly and polite and always there to help you!i definately recommend your residence there!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: lashimi
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant surprise. The staff is very friendly.The hotel is clean and the location wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is excellent, people are friendly and the location perfect!”
Reviews.Author: caxuxa
Reviews.Content: I liked very much the hotel. All the staff is polite and friendly. The rooms are comfortable, the breakfast perfect. And the location is one of the best points. It is possible to go walking to many important places in Istambul

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fangel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in very good spot, near all the places that a visitor wants to see, (Ag. Sophia, Blue Mosque etc) Also it is 2 min walk from the tram station where you can go to Taxim very easily (their tram service is very helpful and very frequent). The hotel is very clean and quiet. The sheets and towels are changed daily. The breakfast was very good with great variety of things. It was very helpful that we had also free internet access from the hotel pc any time of the day. The staff was really helpful and i think it was the best choice for our 5 day trip.

Reviews.Title: “A good, clean hotel close to the main attractions of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: nikolas_from_greece
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very, very clean,close to the main attractions of the old city of Istanbul (Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Basilica Cistern), ie the towels were changed every single day, the rooms were perfectly cleaned as well as the lobbies of the hotel. We specifically asked for a quiet room in the upper floors at the back of the hotel, which it was, although sometimes we were hearing noises from the neighboring rooms. The staff is friendly though some basic English courses would be a bonus-it is really frustrating that people dealing with tourism do not speak at least basic English !. Unfortunately, we had some problems with the bath tub but the staff was really helpful, I must say. The breakfast is no thrills. Also, the wardrobe is supposed to accommodate a coat and maximum a suit. Finally, I think the hotel is overestimated in the booking sites but nonetheless it is a good, reasonably priced choice for Istanbul. The City is so magic that the hotel consideration is only secondary. Sorry, I forgot, a plus is definitely the free transfer form Ataturk airport to the hotel as well as the safebox in the rooms and the satellite TV.

Reviews.Title: “Strategically located, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotting3
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in a room for 3, from Christmas until Oldyear. Everything was well arranged starting with the pick-up service. Breakfast offered a large variety of good quality food, including many local products. It was never boring. Room was sufficiently large. Staff was very helpful. Free internet was fast. The hotel is situated in a small street with many historical attractions nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: riazhzi
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel only after spending days on this website trying to search for the most appropriate hotel, as I was travelling with my three year old son and a ten year old daughter. I must say I found a perfect match in all respects, the location is great as it is close to the tram line and more so close to all the important historical places in Sultanahmet. The free breakfast is plentiful, with good variety of fruits, bread,cheese, sweets, cakes etc. The rooms are clean and modern, modern compared to similar standard hotels in UK; these are cleaned everyday.There is a free WIFI in each room, this made my life easy as I virtually had the whole world at my fingertips. I was fortunate to come across Mehmet; he is the gentleman who checked us in.He is a thorough professional and gave us sound advice on exploring Istanbul.I am sure, I saved around a couple of hundred pounds by heeding to his advice of walking to the places of historical importance, rather than booking expensive city tours that cost around Â£35 per person. The location of the hotel made this possible, as it is pretty close to almost all the places worth paying a visit; this includes Blue mosque, Topkapi palace, Hagia Sofia, Hippodrome, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, Basilica cistern. Mehmet also advised us on good restaurants in the area. All the restaurants close to the hotel are two to three times more expensive, than the ones further up the tram line closer to the Grand Bazaar area. I would recommend a visit to Dolphinarium in Eyup, this is along the Golden horn and is perfect for visitors with children.They have amazing dolphin, whale and sea lion shows. On our departure we were gifted two boxes of Turkish delight sweets and a tea set with apple tea. I am certainly going to stay at this hotel again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: do0dz
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! staff are very friendly and helpful, willing to go out of their way to direct you. One gentleman walked me to where a sufi performance was meant to be held. The hotel is about 3 minute walk to Sirkeci station, and is also close to a major tram line which runs through most major tourist attractions. Great value for money, rooms were clean and were newly renovated, hotel staff maintained cleanliness throughout my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: BinocularsIndia
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Service very personalised, prompt and courteous. The rooms, though a bit small, very cosy and clean. Housekeeping was excellent. Homely atmosphere and quiet elegance. Sophiticated but not stifling.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central hotel”
Reviews.Author: roxanne121
Reviews.Content: I would recommend thwe Maywood. We were there for 4 nights as part of a travelsphere trip and were on the top floor in a triple room. The room was larger than we had expected and the bathroom was fine. Staff were polite and helpful and breakfasthad enough choice to cater for most tastes. The hotel is reasonably central and well within walking distance of a numbet of restaurants, bars, the spice bazaar, Blue Mosque, Haggia Sophia etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for your dollar !”
Reviews.Author: floralsydney
Reviews.Content: We initially chose the Sapphire Hotel (Saffir) in Istanbul based on trip advisor comments, but they were full, so on their recommendation booked their newly refurbished Maywood Hotel which is located only a few streets away. We were all very pleased with our stay (5 nights). Located in the old part of town, a leisurely 20 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, and 7-8 minutes to the ferry terminal, it was an ideal location for us. Good restaurants all around and the street was quiet at night. Our room was not as large as our friend's room, but was well appointed and clean and we had a small balcony off the room. Not enough to sit on, but it was nice to have a bit of fresh air. The bathroom was modern and clean and adequate in size. Buffet breakfast was included and offered fresh fruit, a selection of cold meats, cheeses, pastries and cakes, cereal and boiled eggs, toast and tea or coffee. it was better than we were expecting. The lobby was beautifully furnished with plenty of sqishy sofas and staff on reception were helpful and some spoke good english. A bonus was being able to use the sister hotel facilities which included an indoor pool and sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a quite and convenient part of the city”
Reviews.Author: Togglethatthing05
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Maywood for four days at the end of November and would certainly recommend it to others. The hotel was extremely helpful with our booking arrangements. We travelled with our two teenage daughters and had requested a twin and double room adjacent to each other, which the hotel arranged without any problems. Although the hotel offered to arrange transport, we had decided to take the bus and ferry and walk to the hotel, which is conveniently located near the train station in a very quite backstreet, surrounded by shops and restaurants. It took us about 10 minutes to walk to the hotel from the ferry port Eminonu. Once we were comfortably settled into our rooms we were able to walk to all the major sites â€“ the hotel is about 10 minutes from the Topkapi Palace, 15 minutes from the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque, a little further to the Grand Bazzar, Spice market etc. The rooms themselves were larger than we had expected, well appointed, clean and comfortable. The decoration was obviously recent and well kept. Loads of hot water in the shower and bath. The free tea and coffee making facilities were a definite bonus. If you have ever stayed in a Paris hotel these rooms are palatial by comparison, but obviously sized to a city centre hotel. Our only complaint was that we could hear the radio of the neighbouring room through our air conditioning vent â€“ quickly solved by asking our neighbours to turn down the radio. The hotel was quite although clearly popular. Breakfast was varied and plentiful. All the staff were extremely helpful and spoke good English. The reception and breakfast areas were attractive and spotlessly clean. Istanbul is a great place to visit with friendly people, great food and amazing sites. We intend to come back and would certainly stay in the Maywood again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, location is average”
Reviews.Author: Hockley1614
Reviews.Content: We found the Maywood to be a nice, clean, new hotel. The value was very good overall, with the room being on the small size but was adequate for our needs with two young children. The location was the biggest drawback. Other hotels we have stayed at in Sultanahmet have been closer to the Blue Mosque and had breakfast rooms with views of the Golden Horn. The Maywood is a long walk from the Blue Mosque and its breakfast room is inside with no view. If you are going to Istanbul to see the sights in the old city, try a hotel closer to the sights. The hotels may not be as nice or cost more than the Maywood, but are closer to the things you came to Istanbul to see. If you are interested in a good hotel in general or for business, I would recommend the Maywood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, nice room, mostly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: CaroleNWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the staff had an enormous group to deal with and were less than friendly; all later interactions were just fine. The rooms (and we stayed in 2 different rooms, one at the beginning of our trip, the other at the end) were comfortable although as others have said, the air conditioning units are noisy. Breakfast was OK, some things very good (honey with rose petals to put in the fantastic yogurt), others not. They have the ubiquitous hard boiled eggs found at every buffet and asking for an egg cooked otherwise will cost you a supplement. Too bad the staff in the dining room doesn't smell too good, something we found often throughout the country where many men do not use deodorant, but at breakfast time, it was particularly unpleasant. Because the hotel was full, breakfast dining was somewhat hurried and we felt glared at to leave to make space for other guests. Although it is only a 15 to 20 minute walk uphill from the hotel to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi, etc., the tram 1 1/2 blocks away made getting around easy and helped save energy for walking where you wanted. Easy access also by tram + funicular to Taksim square. We had a near disaster when my suitcase which I had brought downstairs and put off to the side before checking my email (only one computer available for all the guests), when I came back to get it 5 minutes later, it had been moved to the other side with lots of other suitcases where a large group of German tourists were waiting to board their bus and leave town. Thank goodness that disaster was avoided! Overall I would rate the hotel very good with little improvements needed only.

Reviews.Title: “Leaves a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: HazelSweden
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located near the major historical attractions of Istanbul. The rooms and lobby are decorated in a modern Turk-kitsch style. The neighborhood is far from fashionable but OK. The hotel was kept clean. Our room was well-furnished and the bathroom was adequate. However, there is no sound-proofing and the air-conditioning unit makes a lot of noise. Breakfast offered a wide selection but in my opinion nothing good except the white bread. Our kids liked the halva (sesame-paste cake) for breakfast. The hotel restaurant was never open while we stayed at the hotel. Our key-card didn't work for several days. We had to drag a guy from the front desk every-time we wanted to enter our room. When we checked in we were given two separate rooms, despite that we had double-checked our reservation for a triple-room with an extra-bed. We then had to change rooms the day after, and the extra-bed that they after several reminders provided looked like it had been standing in a flooded basement while being eaten by rats (probably had, too). When I said that they had to replace it they brought us another bed. After the first night, we had a triple room facing the street. Directly opposite the hotel there is a bar, where the customers sit outside. When the customers were drunk and loud, we could not sleep. I called the front desk and they said that they would ask them to be quiet and that they would talk to the bar-owner, but if they did we couldn't tell. We tried to drown the bar noise with the air-conditioning and in the end fell asleep from shere exhaustion. It was like this for two nights. The rowdy bar-goers stayed at the Maywood Hotel, and when my husband complained at the front desk, the staff didn't want to talk about it. We would have changed hotels if we had not been with our children, but it seemed too much of a hassle at the time. We tried to change rooms at the hotel but they said that they had nothing available.

Reviews.Title: “fine hotel but not really top end”
Reviews.Author: caribu75
Reviews.Content: - we stayed couple of nights at the Maywood - hotel is well located next to the key sites but in a small street lined up with other hotel and tourist restaurants - the rooms are a bit small but very clean - breakfast was not great - staff is very friendly but not very efficient (we had to ask a couple of time for room service) - nice touch with a present when we left - overall ok but looking back, I would spend $40-50 more to check into a nicer hotel

Reviews.Title: “Charming, well-located and reasonably priced boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Grandma069
Reviews.Content: The Maywood is quite new, with all furnishings shiny and clean, in the popular Sirkeci area within walking distance to cafes, restaurants and local attractions. Very comfortable rooms at treasonable rates, and a lovely buffet breakfast. Great staff, very helpful in assisting us to locate and retrieve missing luggage that had been left behind in London. We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: SG1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in the Maywood hotel in October 2009. Firstly I tried to book the Sapphire hotel but was informed that there were no vacancies and was offered accommodation in their sister hotel the Maywood. I reviewed tripadvisor before agreeing and had no problem with the suggestion based on travellers comments. The hotel is located in the historic part of the city Saltanahmet, which is ideal for major attractions such as the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace and Grand Bazaar to name a few. As we booked through the hotel for more than 3 nights we travelled from the airport to the hotel via an organised shuttle service. Our room was a triple which more than accommodated two adults and one child. The room was clean and we heard very little street noise. The staff were friendly and tried to assist in any requests that we had. They provided guests with a small gift upon checking out. The only real downside to the hotel was the breakfast. As mentioned by previous guests they would be better served cutting down the quanity of the food and replacing it with a smaller quality selection. Apart from the breakfast I probably would rate the hotel 5 stars. We really enjoyed our time in Istanbul, the boat trip on the Bosphorus is an experience I will never forget. The apple tea was superb, we bought a few boxes in the Spice market. We thought the Maywood hotel was a good choice as it was newly renovated and perfectly located within walking distance of the majority of the sites that we wanted to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: willwrite4fun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 days and we were very happy with the hotel. It is within close walking distance to many monuments, etc. and about a 30 min walk from the Grand Bazaar. Our room had space for two twin beds pushed together, plus a table. It was very nice and clean and well appointed, but was a little bit hot. The staff responded right away to show us how to use the air conditioning and after that, it was great. In fact, whenever we needed anything, (iron, dinner reservations, etc.) the staff responded right away. They were also very friendly. I just loved that they gave us a little gift when we arrived and when we left. Very sweet. :) The breakfast buffet was good - lots and lots of choices. The only thing missing was fresh Turkish coffee in those little cups, but honestly, I didn't find that anywhere in the morning. I guess it's more of an afternoon thing for the Turks. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: capitano75
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful. It's completely new (open in March 2009), the rooms are very big and comfortable, with a large bath and extremely clean. It is in a very good position (close to Topkapi palace) to visit the main amenities of Sultanahmet, the heart of Istanbul. The breakfast offers a huge quantity of delicious things. The personnel is kind and they even gave us a turkish gift before leaving. Last but not least, the price is very good, especially if you pay cash.

Reviews.Title: “A Treasure in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: Kathio
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this fabulous little hotel earlier this month. We loved the idea that they insisted upon picking us up at the airport, a service that was included in the price. The reception staff was always friendly and helpful. Our room, overlooking the street, was quiet, clean and not nearly as small as we had been expecting, given the Old Town location. Nice bathroom, in-room safe and room darkening window coverings all contributed to our comfort. The location, steps from the tram is easy walking distance to all the main attractions. Ample choices at breakfast made it difficult to choose. We couldn't have asked for more in a 3 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel, We took a risk and were delighted”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Wanderer60
Reviews.Content: We were referred to this hotel as the Shaphire was full. It is located on the edge of the developed area in the Sultanate area of Istanbul. We were a little nervous about the area, but it turned out to be just fine. It is within walking distance of all the sights, one block from the metro, close to some great restaurants. We easily walked to the Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, Blue Mosque, etc. We often returned, on foot, late at night, without a problem - though I would scout out the area during the day to get your bearings. The rooms are smallish, but well appointed, and sparkling clean. Staff was great.- we needed an extra electral convertor, and the front desk sent someone to the sister hotel to pick one up for us - and this was the middle of the night!
