Room Service did not replenish the soap or tea, one day, but other than that, no complaints. We didn't bother to call, but I feel it would have been tended. The breakfast buffet was not as extensive as others we had on this trip, but it was ample, and fresh. that is the only meal served in the hotel - there is no restuarant, as such. We were glad we gave this place a try, and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean hotel near major attractions”
Reviews.Author: cliffcliff
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel during September with my wife Positives - Rooms were very clean in new or like new condition - Excellent water pressure in bathrooms - Friendly, Well Meaning Staff - Centrally located about 15 minute walk to most major attractions - Room size small but fine for two people who are touring the city - Rooms were pretty much soundproof from outside noise and it was on a quiet street Negatives -Staff does not speak English welll and weren't able to explain all the details about the hotel. We wanted to use the phone in our room but they didn't know the cost - Breakfast was a massive affair of quantity over quality. Literally 15 different types of breads, 6 types of fruits, 4 types of meats and cheeses, 4 types of cereal etc. They should cut the selection by 75% and just try to do a few things a little better. Eggs were either powdered or overcooked into oblivion. I ate cheese and bread each day, which was ok.

Reviews.Title: “The Maywood is a friendly and comfortable small hotel with easy access to transportation and key sites.”
Reviews.Author: hofs71
Reviews.Content: Though not located on the best street, the area felt safe and was just one block from shopping and restaurants. The hotel was opened in February 2009. It is located in an older building, but has been totally renovated and updated. The hotel staff did everything possible to make our stay a comfortable visit. Mr. Murat, who operated the front desk, is to be commended for his excellent service. The room was very clean. There is an extensive free continental breakfast buffet, geared more toward European tastes than American. We booked the hotel through their website and as a result, had one-way free private car transportation to the airport. This is optional as to whether you want it to or from the airport or port. The hotel is located within walking distance to the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. We definitely enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Maubee
Reviews.Content: We really liked it here. It was on a fairly quiet street, yet close to tram stops and some excellent restaurants. Walking to the touristy areas was quick and easy but we weren't in the thick of it. The staff was plenty helpful but impersonal compared to reviews I've read about many hotels in Sultanahmet -- however we are used to that in the states and we were fine with it. We rarely needed help anyway. I thought they had 1 of the better breakfast buffets we encountered on our trip. They had different options every few days and the fresh plums and other fruits and vegetables were excellent. Both white and wheat bread were available for toast. The smoked turkey meat was delicious! If you ask for it they'll cook an omelet for a bit more variety. The coffee and OJ are instant, but that's standard every place we stayed. They did pad the offerings with a bunch of packaged cookies/cakes (like Hostess or Little Debbie in the US) but the spread was large enough that it didn't matter and I suppose kids must like those? The rooms were fairly large for Europe. A single was a good deal and only a bit smaller than the double (though singles are darker generally, not a problem for us since we mainly used room for sleeping). Didn't use TV, but the WiFi access was the best on the trip with 2 routers on each floor. Great air conditioning system though a little cryptic to run. We never ran out of hot water and the tub was great for soaking after a long day walking up/down hills. Beds were very comfortable and the pillows were the best on the trip, with extra pillows in the room at check in. The in-room safe was easy to use and you choose the number to open it each time you use it. There was an electric kettle in room for making tea and instant coffee. Small fridge with mini-bar had room to chill a few bottles of our own water (and a small raki). There is a closet with hangers and a small dresser and some other storage in the room to keep things less cluttered, though there were no luggage racks.. This felt like a modern hotel, a little impersonal; but it did have the convenience of 2 fast elevators, wifi and clean modern room layout. We liked that. For this area I didn't see any other economical options with the same level of comfort and cleanliness in my research. Comparing this to hotels that cost twice as much (as many reviews and forum posts seem to do - referencing Swissotel or Sirkeci Konak) seems odd. One might as well compare it to hotels costing half as much - they'd be much much worse I'm sure. BTW we paid much less than they are quoting as average cost here on trip advisor - 90E for a double, 70E for a single before cash discount per night (~130/100 USD).

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel - would recommend”
Reviews.Author: UKflashpacker
Reviews.Content: Tried to book another hotel who suggested this to us as it was their sister hotel. When booking we were warned that the rooms were small so wonder if we would be in a broom cupboard. The room was not the largest I have ever stayed in but was big enough and was tastefully decorated and spotlessly clean. The bathroom was of a similar standard. Staff very helpful. Buffet breakfast included - plenty of choices and items topped up if they ran out, did special requests re eggs etc - only complaint re breakfast was that the fruit juice weak cordial. Free wi fi was good. located between the railway station and Topeki Palace so central for all attractions - furthest away was the grand bazaar which took 10-15mins to walk. Quiet location as just off the main drag. Only other downside is that there isn't a view from the windows (unless you count the guy in the room of the building opposite watching internet porn 1st thing in the morning!). We enjoyed our stay in this hotel and would recommend it to others without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but very overrated in reviews”
Reviews.Author: usa30
Reviews.Content: After several days at the Maywood we are staggered that anyone could call it a favorite. Rooms are small, service is friendly but often not helpful, and the breakfast is awful in a city abounding in wonderful fresh food. There is satellite TV but the only English language station is al-Jazeera. We heard someone ask how much a taxi would cost to go to a major attraction and the front desk receptionist answered by saying he was not a taxi driver. Beware the reviews for the Maywood on Tripadvisor; some of the enthusiasts cannot have been to any nice hotels if they think this is one of the best. It's pretty average.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jexpat
Reviews.Content: We (my husband, our 16-year old, and I) stayed in the Maywood Hotel just after the Ramadan holiday in September. They warned us that their rooms are smaller as they are in the old part of the city. Their triple room was not available, but they gave us a 'family' room; 2 beds pushed together, and a 3rd bed added. There was still plenty of floor space for suitcases and walking. Beds were quite comfortable, the AC worked well, the flat-screen TV had some English channels, and the front-desk staff was very helpful. There is wifi throughout the hotel, and a computer for anyone's use in the lobby. The breakfast buffet is plentiful and well-stocked, and the dining staff are also friendly and love to talk to anyone who wants to pick their brains about Istanbul. There is a parking garage on the premises (a huge plus if you are crazy enough to need a car in Istanbul), but I don't know if they charge for it. The best part of the hotel is the LOCATION. Istanbul is a big, bustling city. Maywood is a block off the main street with the tramline, so it is a quiet haven after a busy day. It's extremely convenient to get to - just an easy 5-minute walk from the main train station or the tram stop. All the major sights in the old town are easily walkable (or tram, if your feet are tired!) from the hotel, as are many restaurants and lots of shops. On the down side, with three of us in the room, we had to ask for more toilet paper every day! (The first day they put two rolls in the bathroom, but after that only one roll). Easy enough. Also, we learned to take quick showers or space them out, as the water totally turned off for about 1 minute by the time the third person was in there. I would recommend this hotel. The price is right, the location is perfect for touring, and it's a quiet setting in a busy city. It's clean and open, in a city that tends to be a bit on the dirty side. They even gave us two little gifts as we checked out! Very thoughtful!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is a reasonable option for those on a tight budget, albeit with tiny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: lafa08
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a reasonable option for those on a tight budget looking for a clean place just to sleep. It is convenient to public transport and the sultanhamet area. The staff were very helpful. The hotel rooms are clean albeit extremely small. Barely enough space to fit two suitcases and a double bed. You could hear noise from the adjacent street until 2am. The breakfast was poor, we didn't even bother having it after the first day. I would definetely not consider this in the top 10 hotels in istanbul. We stayed at Swissotel for part of our stay which was in a different league and we thought it was much better value for money, i.e quality breakfast, service, superb views, gym, pool etc.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulR1013
Reviews.Content: I'd rate the Maywood Hotel as being as good as any city hotel we've stayed in anywhere in the world, (and that includes those in London & New York). Though only a comparatively small 'boutique' hotel the levels of service, decor, position and cleanliness are ones which larger, better known hotels would do well to strive for. The staff are courteous, helpful and very efficient & the rooms and public areas are clean and pleasingly decorated. The hotel itself is perfectly located in the old part of the city, being convenient for most of the main attractions and historical sites and is only a short tram ride from the Bosphorus and Golden Horn, (the tram system is easy to use even for a non-Turkish speaker), yet the room we occupied was quiet enough to have the window open at night, (though not necessary as the aircon worked very efficiently anyway). Finally the rates are very reasonable, especially considering its prime location in the city. I would highly recommend the Maywood to anyone planning a city break to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location, service and employees.”
Reviews.Author: SLCNomad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sept, 09, based on reviews I had read in Trip Advisor. My partner and I were very pleased with our double room at 80 Euros. Bathroom was modern and very nice, AC worked well, sound proofing was excellent (only heard the muzzein call to prayer if we had the window open), inexpensive public transportation was readily available, we could easily walk to all the Old Town attractions, the Galata Bridge was within 10 minutes, and the tram station was right there, The breakfast buffet was a highlight with a wide variety of fruits, cereals, meats, cheeses, beverages and pastries. The manager was very helpful with several faxes we had to receive and send. I liked it"

Reviews.Title: “Hidden City Centre Gem”
Reviews.Author: Haynest
Reviews.Content: A quiet, comfortable hidden gem of an hotel, centrally located for all the sights and amenities in Istanbul. Rooms are spacious, clean and well maintained. Front of house staff are exemplary and nothing was too difficult for them to arrange/assist with. An excellent spread is provided for buffet breakfast [however, serving staff could do with a little inspiration]. A useful feature is a red/green light system that tells housekeeping and other staff whether they can enter the room to clean it etc. [rather than the "do not disturb" signs that can fall off]. I made two bookings at the hotel a week apart and received the same email word for word canvassing for a good recommendation to be forwarded to my accommodation booking agency after each stay. Nonetheless, I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “High standard, good location, low price.”
Reviews.Author: Bogna
Reviews.Content: We occupied triple room which was really comfortable. I was very surprised because of very high standard of this hotel taking into account low price and very good location close to most important sights of Istambul - Topkapi palace, Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar. It is also very good place to travel around Istanbul - tram and ferries are very close. I can recommend this hotel to everybody who want to stay in heart of old town in luxurious hotel for a good price. It is not good choice for people counting on pool and fitness center. Hotel offers one way airport transfer for free, also wireless internet access in rooms is free. Staff was really nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in ideal location friendly staff good breakfast would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: surgeonManchester
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been recently renovated. The rooms are clean and comfortable with effective air conditioning. Breakfast was excellent. Staff very helpful and friendly. Situation fantastic within walking distance of Topkapi, Bazaar, Metro and ferries. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for a business traveller”
Reviews.Author: SKDxb
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul on a business trip. I found that the loacation of this hotel was ideal to meet my business contacts. The rooms are very well maintained, and the staff were very friendly. Being in the midst of the tourist hot spots, this hotel could serve both the tourist as well as the business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly hotel in a lovely setting”
Reviews.Author: dr_von_Duell
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new, modern and clean. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located in a very quiet street, but also very close to all the main sights in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “perfect choice for Istambul”
Reviews.Author: CiprianRO
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but very clean and quiet. It's a great location and the staff couldn't have been better. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good try”
Reviews.Author: bonvoyage17
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night in the Maywood Hotel, having decided to try two different hotels for our first two nights in Istanbul, and hopefully choosing one (or another) for our final four nights ten days later... Although the Maywood puts on a good show (free sweet drink offered upon arrival, a box of Turkish Delight plus sweet apple tea drink and tea cups as gifts on checking out) we were not impressed with the location or the impersonal feeling of a pseudo-"grand hotel". As we left earlier than official breakfast time we believed the meagre offerings we were allowed was because not everything was set up yet - reading other reviews leads me to believe that there wasn't much else... The room was clean and comfortable but we felt it lacked charm. This, of course, is subjective... We chose to stay in Sultanahmet ultimately for our return to the city. I wouldn't dissuade others from staying, but if you're looking for something more personal and charming, look elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Drew311
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Turkey this past April and stayed at the Maywood. It's a perfect location and the staff couldn't have been better. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly”
Reviews.Author: Peksu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Maywood with my wife on a weekend trip to Istanbul. What a great and versatile city! For exploring the Sultanahmet area Maywood is ideally located, just 5 minutes from e.g. Topkapi's west entrance. It's also very convenient for ferries across Bosporus to Galata side shopping etc. Service was very good and friendly, we even got a small gift at departure. Breakfast was quite good as well, lots of local dishes. Rooms are new and clean, and nicely decorated. All in all a great choice in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Topillo
Reviews.Content: It is located in the best possible. You can go walking everywhere -to the Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, the port...-. With the best value for money. The staff is very kind and they are always ready to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Maywood Hotel is Excellant in Everything”
Reviews.Author: JehadHS
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean, Location is Unique, Very close to transportation facilities, Like Train, Taxi, and Boat. You can visit most of historical places by walk, Its Located in "Sirkeci" area which is very interested for Istanbul visitors, Hotel Staff is very nice, honest and Co-operative. I and my family enjoyed our time by staying in the hotel and walk in the area around the hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Really excellent from all points of view”
Reviews.Author: Carole_CParis
Reviews.Content: To recommend : - best location and best quality price. - Very agreable and clean rooms. - Helpful personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat - super clean rooms - honest management”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_5050_6
Reviews.Content: I found Maywood Hotel through Tripadvisor for our August 2009 trip. My email correspondence for the reservation was with Mr Engin Evsen (the boss) as yours probably will be if you book the room electronically. I was initially somewhat nervous about providing credit card information on the web to a boutique hotel internationally but the hotel has a secure site - and I found the management to be straightforward and exceptionally honest. I needed to change the date of my reservation - all of which Mr Evsen handled without problem. We stayed for 7 nights and the location could not have been better. The hotel is located in Sirkeci which is an easy walk to all the must -see attractions. The key mode of transportation for toursits is the tram and the Gulhane Park and Sirkeci tram stops are a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel has 5 floors which gives it apersonal, boutique feel unlike the large impersonal 50 story hotels. The service is excellent, and the staff goes out of their way to accommodate special requests. The hotel is brand new - and the hardwood floors and brand new bathrooms were terrific. The bathrooms were super-clean, modern and the enclosed shower/tub area was very nice. Our kids were expecting bathrooms in Istanbul to be not-so-nice, and the hotel's bathroom area far exceeded our expectations. Mr Evsen also oversees the company's other hotel, Sapphire, but he is usually at the hotel twice a day. The staff's goal is to keep the guests happy...and tmanagement understands the value of satisfied customers. There was a sumptuous complimentary breakfast with enough varieties to please Eastern and Western tastes with lots of fresh fruit options. What I like best about Maywood Hotel is the prime location - to be honest the location is so convenient that we never needed to use public restrooms - the hotel was never more than a few minutes away from where we were. Secondly, I loved the size of Maywood Hotel. if we had stayed at a large chain hotel we would have probably have experienced an impersonal "punch in, punch out" type of service that is often associated with large organizations. With Maywood Hotel, we feel we got a great value; super-clean accomodations; a touch of local flavor; and, a location that just can't be beat - whether you walk or take the tram. I also REALLY appreciated the complimentary airport shuttle service. We had heard a lot of stories about cab-driver scams, and it was great to emerge from the passport line, retrieve our baggage and see a friendly and accommodating driver holding a sign with our name on it. Mr. Evsen was pro-active enough to give us a contact number if for any reason we did not see our driver - but everything worked like clockwork. Mr Evsen and his team made our stay thoroughly enjoyable. My wife and I were traveling with an adult daughter, two teenagers and 12 year old - and having problem-free and strategically located accommodations really made a huge difference. We are very grateful to the hotel for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: barnabusmaximus
Reviews.Content: The Maywood was our first taste of Istanbul and an excellent introduction. The free Ataturk airport pick-up (currently provided if you stay more than two nights and book via the hotelâ€™s site) went very smoothly â€“ despite our slightly delayed arrival at 23:30. Nb - Taxi back to Ataturk airport cost 35 Lira. I really enjoyed the hotel location (7 mins walk to the Topkai palace, Hagia Sophia and Blue mosque) but in a quiet street without any touts. The staff were very charming without being OTT. The hotel manager noted during booking that the rooms were small â€“ but in reality they were fine and very clean. We werenâ€™t disrupted by noise from other guests / outside the hotel. The Hotel TV had around 600 channels, free wireless internet was fast enough for regular browsing. The inclusive breakfast buffet offered a decent spread (I had figs, apricots, halva, watermelon; brown bread with honey and jam). Overall, we had a fantastic stay here â€“ it ticks all the boxes: location, service, comfort, price. Iâ€™d stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: food4you
Reviews.Content: I liked the friendly staff, the clean room (almost new), the LCD TV with lots of English channels, the free wireless, the great breakfast, the bellhop ready to carry my two big bags to my room, the elevator, the totally quiet night of rest, close to all the sights (I walked to Galata Tower across the bridge). betweeen 2 tram stops, good restaurants not far away, comfortable bed (not rock hard)... I hope they have a view of the bay someday - that would make it perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and friendly... in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: TyGor
Reviews.Content: The Maywood hotel is located within walking distance to the Topkapi palace, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. It is in the old part of town and you can easily access the tram system and ferries on the Bosphorous. The rooms are small but very clean and quiet. It has been recently renovated. The breakfast is generous and offers great variety. We particularly enjoyed the friendly, helpful staff. They made us feel very welcome! We would highly recommend the Maywood!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: sandi0001
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly suited if you wanted to walk to the major tourist sites. We ended up walking everywhere rather than doing a bus tour (worked out as a cheaper and a much nicer way to se ehte city). The staff were super friendly and went out of the way to assist. Everything from fetching us bottled water to recommending restaurants etc. The room was a decent size and very clean. Excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sqweet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Maywood for 4 nights. Everything from the complimentary airport transfer to the rooms was great and we were really satisfied with our stay. It was very good value for the money we paid, especially when we travelled in the height of Summer. My only comment would be is to get to the breakfast buffet before 9am. As we were on holidays we tended to sleep in and when we got downstairs the buffet was looking a little depleted. There were a lot of comments on TripAdvisor about the size of the rooms, whilst they were small it was really not a problem. If you are in Istanbul to see the sights and tour, the last thing you will be doing is spending time in your room. Overall very happy customers.

Reviews.Title: “In that particular area, can not expect better”
Reviews.Author: Saraculkiki
Reviews.Content: Pro's: great location close to old city touristic atractions; friendly staff; cleanliness of the rooms; tram is very close and can take you to all locations; parking place below the hotel was a very nice surprize (not mentioned in the hotel's properties); room is quiet for this location; bathrooms with floor heat system for fast dry. Con's: rooms with the interior view have nothing to see but more to be aware; breakfast was quite poor and no turkish coffee available

Reviews.Title: “The place you're happy to came back after a full day ride in this mavellous city!”
Reviews.Author: Micol12
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed there for 4 days. We had fully appreciated staff attentiveness, room comfort and beauty and the perfect position with main amenities within walking distance. We warmly recommend this hotel! Last but not least very good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice and friendly staff, clean and safe”
Reviews.Author: Hanna_Serbia
Reviews.Content: After reading many positive reviews of this hotel on this site, we decided to book. It was really what we wanted - hotel has a great location and you can walk to all major sights, and the tram stop is 2 min away. The good thing is that is not on the main tram street so it is very quiet. We had free airport pick-up service, room was clean, staff always friendly and smiling. This was our first time in Istanbul and we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to Sirkeci railway station”
Reviews.Author: soppa
Reviews.Content: Maywood is a new hotel (opened 2009) close to Sirkeci railway station. It defines itself as boutique hotel. It truly is a cosy place with good service but the surrounding are quite ragged. If you like to be close to Bazaar district and Sultanahmet without being at the center of the tourist trap -- Maywood might be the place for you. The rooms are quite small, breakfast many-sided and front desk staff friendly -- even though only a few of them can English. The Bosphor boats are just a few blocks away, Topkapi around the corner etc. The hotel is very clean but they are not overly environmental friendly. Even though we asked not to change sheets and towels every day they did it anyhow. Anyhow we have absolutely nothing to complain. Nice hotel and we wish nothing but the best with their business!

Reviews.Title: “The Maywood is an excellent, just-restored, boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: summerwindcruise
Reviews.Content: The Maywood is an excellent, just-restored, boutique hotel located within easy walk of all of the principle historical sights of Old Istanbul. The room was spacious by European standards (we added a cot for a 3rd person in a double), with brand new appointments including a flat-panel screen TV with 1000 station satellite access (about 800 free) in every conceivable European language. The air-conditioner was easily set to and controlled the ambient temperature to one degree in either C or F. We didn't use a well-stocked minibar. Bedside lighting was good for reading. The new bathroom included tub with adjustable shower. An electronic password safe big enough for a laptop is bolted in the closet. A bill-problem was resolved amicably Entry and egress from the bath tub in the room we had could be an issue for elderly or handicapped, because the step in and out are high off of the floor.

Reviews.Title: “the best boutique hotel in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: KuwaitRanda
Reviews.Content: From the warm welcome,we were served juice and turkish delight, shown a map of Istanbul, and told the main attractions. To our lovely room,comfortable mattress, clean bathroom,quiet surroundings,turkish breakfast, net in the rooms. They gladly did all our tour bookings, and our restaurant bookings. till we checked out,with lovely souvenirs, the staff couldn't have been sweeter, helpfull or more co operative. i will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeatrixSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms were fairly small ,we never felt cramped.The staff was outstanding and could not have done more.I will stay there again.Fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “there is no better place to stay in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: EDUDUSP
Reviews.Content: honestly it felt like a leading hotel of the world!!!!!! amazing staff great place nice rooms!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and great value”
Reviews.Author: MontrealDocholiday
Reviews.Content: Beautiful boutique hotel. Everything is new and tastefully decorated. Great value, very helpful staff, good breakfast. Nice short walk to most sites. Would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very helpful staff. I would stay again in.”
Reviews.Author: TravellerNN
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice surprise, I like location, staff, room.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret....Maywood Hotel in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Sacketts
Reviews.Content: This newly opened hotel (February) was such a marvellous surprise. It is centrally located for all the "must see" sites, has great rooms and bathrooms, is spotless and above all QUIET. The breakfast is included in the price and is full Turkish-style, even including Turkish Delight !! The staff is super-helpful and friendly. An absolute gem of a place and at the right price too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with friendly&helpful staff..”
Reviews.Author: Yasmin_Lavender
Reviews.Content: We've visited this amazing city beginning of June and stayed in great hotel Maywood and it's sister hotel Sapphire for a week..everything was absolutely brilliant..Location of the both hotels,rooms and especially the staff.I would like to thank you to front office staff and their manager Mr.Engin, one more time for their service.We'll definetly come back this place in very near future.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely satisfied”
Reviews.Author: 40_something_9
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 5 nights. Free airport transfer was provided without my even asking for it. Staff extremely friendly from the start, offering welcome drink. Twin room on 4th floor decent size, modern, tastefully furnished, comfortable beds, good bathroom; we chose back view, not at all picturesque but quiet. Breakfast buffet (included) perfectly adequate. Excellent location, quiet street but easy walking distance to all main tourist attractions, plus main tram line. No restaurant, but loads of eating options around. Hotel unequivocally recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed every bit of our Trip”
Reviews.Author: keegan-TRIP
Reviews.Content: My husband had booked this as a surprise for us and I was hoping and praying he had chosen correctly...we were not disappointed at all. Good location, clean, quiet and comfortable room and breakfast although bit bland was perfectly adequate, we were able to pick something each morning from the spread to get us started. We found the front desk staff to be extremely polite and helpful and there were a few very considerate touches that had been addded so overall for the price we were really pleased. We booked direct with the hotel and again were extremely pleased with the price and the communications from the hotel. I do not doubt that there are many more hotels that will offer luxury but we do not intend to spend most of our time in a hotel room so would not want to pay those prices. I would consider using the hotel again for exploring this fantastic city and cannot wait to return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “great location but dismal room”
Reviews.Author: thefridgemagnet
Reviews.Content: had high hopes on basis of tripadvisor recmndns but was disappointed. the location was terrific but the room was pretty rubbish -- yes, clean, but only (small) window pointed into small light well so barely any natural light and barely room to walk around bed. brekkie mediocre, aircon not working (though was fairly promptly fixed). reasonable value, top location; otherwise nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “bedclothes on the floor and other seedy stories”
Reviews.Author: ximimixi
Reviews.Content: The only good thing I can tell about this hotel is that it's quite brand new and that the price is not too high for the Istanbul standards (70 â‚¬). As other customers say the staff is not helpful at all. As we arrived, we asked for a map, the man at reception pointed behind us where we could see a display stand with postcards and some maps, we had to pay 5 TL (2,5 â‚¬) for a map that we later saw for half the price. Obvously they didn't have complimentary maps nor any kind of information. When we asked for direccions at the front desk, they had no idea and their answer was alway the same: take a taxi. As we returned to the hotel at night, we always found our safety box open, we complained at the front desk and they said thay may be batteries( ??????) were out. Crazy, isn't it? It was supposed to be wifi internet everywhere in the hotel but in fact it wasn't, not even at the lobby. All we get from the staff was "we don't know why it doesn work". Bedclothes were really coarse, particularly the upper sheet. Air coinditioned was very noisy, even at the minimum, therefore you had to decide between noise or heat. Breakfast was mediocre and coffee tasted terribly bad. To end, I would like to tell about someting that I found specially outrageous: the poor woman that cleaned the rooms didn't have a trolley or something similar to carry all she needed to do her job, so fresh bedclothes and all the products were on the floor, in the corridor and she had to walk up and down to get them. I suppose working conditions and worker rights are not like the UE standards but in this case it's just a matter of image and the image that customers get from Maywood hotel is really seedy. My (wise) advise: do not choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “#3 in Istanbul, really?”
Reviews.Author: loudo16
Reviews.Content: At the time of this review, Maywood hotel was third on TA in Istanbul. I suspect this won't last. I don't want to send the wrong impression, this hotel is not that bad: it had the most comfortable bed we've had in our trip (2 weeks, 7 hotels), the room are small but of very high standard (it shows this hotel is new) and actually quite nice. Location is indeed great (and quiet). Mini-bar is also surprisingly affordable. Stupid detail, but I liked the fact that you can set the temperature of the room with 0.5 degree increment. Finally, it's a good value at 70 euro. But it's certainly not great. The lobby & eating area decor are uber cheesy & over the top. I'm not the Turkish design expert but I doubt this is very traditional like other TA reviewers mentioned. Service is as blend as it could be. I tried 2 classic test question: - What's my options to go to the airport? - How do I get to Bebek (Istanbul neighborhood)? All I got was: "Taxi"... (BTW, very easy to go to the airport with tram & metro) Breakfast is by far the worst we've had during our trip. Sorry, but either they changed the buffet or other reviewers had bad luck during their trip, but I can't see how someone could say the breakfast is great. Only one option for fresh fruit (water melon), no eggs, the biggest variety of dry & uninspiring crackers and cookies... I would be happy to land in this hotel with Hotwire.com, not so much with TripAdvisor top 5 Istanbul. It's just a bit blend, not that "boutique". I doubt you'll be very disappointed staying in at the Maywood hotel, but being at the end of our trip, after visiting gem hotels around Turkey, this one definitely didn't rock our world. Oh, and no roof terrace. I only visited two hotels in Istanbul (didn't help Maywood that our first one was the Witt Istanbul Suites) but I hope there is more authentic & friendly spots out there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time at Maywood Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pepene
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time at Maywood Hotel. The hotel is centrally-located, and very pleasant. Staff are welcoming and always willing to help, rooms were very clean, spacious and beautifully-decorated with traditional Turkish, breakfast was varied and plentiful. Would definitely come back any time.

HotelInfo.Name: Maywood Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Nobethane Caddesi No:25 | Sirkeci, Istanbul, Turkey
